src: Asigurați-vă că mâna rămâne cât mai relaxată posibil în timp ce cântați toate notele corect – și încercați și să nu faceți prea multe mișcări inutile cu degetele. În acest fel, vă veți obosi cât mai puțin posibil. Nu uitați că nu este nevoie să apăsați cu forță clapele pentru un sunet mai puternic, cum e cazul la pian. La acordeon, pentru a mări volumul, se manipulează burduful mai puternic și mai rapid.
mt: 1. Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while playing all the notes correctly – and try not to make too many unnecessary movements with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself as little as possible. Don't forget that you don't need to press the keys harder for a louder sound, as is the case with the piano. At the accordion, to increase the volume, the bellows are manipulated more strongly and faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

This way, you will tire yourself as little as possible. Don't forget that you don't need to press the keys harder for a louder sound, as is the case with the piano. At the accordion, to increase the volume, the bellows are manipulated more strongly and faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Una dintre cele mai uzuale probleme atunci când se încearcă convertirea unui film în format DVD este suprascanarea. Majoritatea televizoarelor sunt făcute în așa fel încât să fie pe placul publicului larg. Din acest motiv, toate filmele pe care le vedem la TV sunt tăiate sus, jos și în lateral. Acest lucru este făcut pentru a se asigura că imaginea acoperă întregul ecran. Asta se numește suprascanare. Din nefericire, la crearea unui DVD, marginile imaginii vor fi cel mai probabil tăiate și, dacă filmul avea subtitrări prea apropiate de marginea de jos, acestea nu vor fi afișate complet.
mt: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a film into DVD format is overscan. Most televisions are made to be user-friendly. For this reason, all the films we see on TV are cut top, bottom and sides. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. This is called overscan. Unfortunately, when creating a DVD, the edges of the image will most likely be cut and if the film had subtitles too close to the bottom edge, they will not be displayed completely.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Planul american s-a bazat pe lansarea coordonată a atacurilor din trei direcții diferite. Generalul John Cadwalder a lansat un atac de diversiune împotriva garnizoanei britanice de la Bordentown, cu scopul de a bloca trimiterea de întăriri. Generalul James Ewing a traversat râul la Trenton Ferry alături de 700 de oameni din trupele de miliție, a ocupat podul peste Assunpink Creek și a împiedicat retragerea trupelor inamice. Forța principală de asalt, compusă din 2.400 de oameni, urma să traverseze râul la nouă mile la nord de Trenton și să se împartă în două grupuri, unul comandat de Greene și unul de Sullivan, în scopul de a lansa un atac înaintea zorilor.
mt: The American plan was based on coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder launched a diversion attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, with the goal of blocking reinforcements. General James Ewing crossed the river at Trenton Ferry with 700 militia troops, took the bridge over Assunpink Creek and blocked the retreat of the enemy troops. The main assault force, consisting of 2,400 men, was to cross the river nine miles north of Trenton and split into two groups, one commanded by Greene and one by Sullivan, with the goal of launching an attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: După adoptarea sa de către Congres pe 4 iulie, o ciornă scrisă de mână, semnată de președintele Congresului John Hancock și de secretarul Charles Thomson, a fost trimisă apoi la tipografia lui John Dunlap, aflată la câteva străzi distanță. „În cursul nopții, au fost făcute între 150 și 200 de copii, cunoscute ca «postere Dunlap».” În data de 8 iulie, a fost făcută prima lectură publică a documentului, de către John Nixon, în curtea Independence Hall. Una a fost trimisă lui George Washington pe 6 iulie, care a citit-o trupelor sale în New York pe 9 iulie. O copie a ajuns la Londra pe 10 August. Cele 25 de postere Dunlap încă existente sunt cele mai vechi copii ale documentului care au supraviețuit. Manuscrisul original nu mai există.
mt: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft, signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson, was then sent to the printing house of John Dunlap, a few blocks away. “During the night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, known as ‘Dunlap broadsides.’” On July 8, the first public reading of the document was made by John Nixon, in the courtyard of Independence Hall. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who read it to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 surviving Dunlap broadsides are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original manuscript no longer exists.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Coloniștii, observând această activitate, au chemat, de asemenea, întăriri. Trupele care au întărit pozițiile avansate au inclus regimentele 1 și al 3 din New Hampshire cu 200 de oameni, sub comanda coloneilor John Stark și James Reed (ambii au devenit mai târziu generali). Oamenii lui Stark au ocupat poziții de-a lungul gardului situat la nord de poziția colonialiștilor. Când mareea joasă a deschis un decalaj de-a lungul râului Mystic și de-a lungul nord estului peninsulei, ei au extins rapid gardul cu un zid scurt de piatră spre nord, care se termină la marginea apei cu o mică plajă. Gridley sau Stark au înfipt un țăruș la vreo 100 de picioare (30 m) în fața gardului și au ordonat ca nimeni să nu tragă înainte ca oamenii obișnuiți să treacă de el.
mt: The colonists, observing this activity, also called for reinforcements. Troops who reinforced the advanced positions included the 1st and 3rd regiments of New Hampshire with 200 men, under the command of Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence situated north of the colonial position. When the low tide opened a gap along the river Mystic and the northeast peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north, which ends at the water's edge with a small beach. Gridley or Stark drove a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered no one to fire until the regulars had passed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: China antică avea un mod unic de a delimita diferite perioade de timp; fiecare etapă a Chinei sau fiecare familie care deținea puterea au reprezentat o dinastie distinctă. De asemenea, perioadele dintre dinastii consecutive au fost marcate de provincii divizate. Intervalul de acest fel cel mai bine cunoscut a fost Perioada celor Trei Regate, de-a lungul a 60 de ani între dinastiile Han și Jin. În timpul acestor perioade au avut loc războaie crâncene între mulți nobili care se luptau pentru tron. Perioada celor Trei Regate a fost una dintre epocile cele mai sângeroase din istoria Chinei antice, mii de oameni murind luptându-se să ocupe tronul din mărețul palat de la Xi’an.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of delineating different periods of time; each stage of China or each family that held power represented a distinct dynasty. Also, periods between consecutive dynasties were marked by divided provinces. The best-known interval of this type was the Period of the Three Kingdoms, over 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During these periods, there were fierce wars between many nobles who fought for the throne. The Period of the Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in ancient Chinese history, thousands of people dying fighting to occupy the throne in the great palace at Xi’an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Coloniile de furnici legionare de asemenea mărșăluiesc și formează mușuroaie în diverse faze. În faza nomadă, furnicile soldați mărșăluiesc noaptea și se odihnesc în timpul zilei. Colonia începe o fază nomadă atunci când cantitatea de hrană disponibilă scade. În timpul acestei faze, colonia creează cuiburi temporare, care sunt schimbate în fiecare zi. Fiecare dintre aceste dezlănțuiri sau marșuri nomade durează în jur de 17 zile.
mt: Ant colonies also march and form mounds in various phases. In the nomadic phase, soldier ants march at night and rest during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when the available food supply decreases. During this phase, the colony creates temporary nests, which are changed every day. Each of these outbreaks or nomadic marches lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Multe ritmuri observate în fiziologie și în comportament deseori depind în mod crucial de prezența ciclurilor endogene și producția lor prin ceasurile biologice. Ritmurile ciclice, care nu reprezintă simple răspunsuri la stimuli externi periodici, au fost observate în cea mai mare parte a ființelor vii, inclusiv bacteriile, ciupercile, plantele și animalele. Ceasurile biologice sunt oscilatoare autosuficiente care vor continua să funcționeze pentru o perioadă de timp, chiar în absența stimulilor externi.
mt: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often depend crucially on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production by biological clocks.  Circadian rhythms, which are not simply responses to periodic external stimuli, have been observed in most living things, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.  Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that will continue to function for a period of time, even in the absence of external stimuli.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: O populație reprezintă totalitatea organismelor dintr-o anumită specie prezente într-o zonă geografică dată. Când toți indivizii dintr-o populație sunt identici în ceea ce privește o anumită caracteristică fenotipică, aceștia sunt cunoscuți ca monomorfi. Când indivizii prezintă mai multe variante ale unei anumite trăsături, aceștia se numesc polimorfi.
mt: A population is the total of organisms of a given species present in a given geographical area. When all individuals in a population are identical in terms of a particular phenotypic characteristic, they are known as monomorphic. When individuals present more than one variant of a particular trait, they are called polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Turismul organizat în jurul explorării naturii atrage persoane interesate să viziteze ambiente naturale pentru a se bucura de peisaj, inclusiv de animalele sălbatice și de vegetație. Exemplele de activități pe teren includ vânătoarea, pescuitul, fotografia, privitul păsărilor, precum și vizitarea parcurilor și studierea informațiilor cu privire la ecosistem. Un exemplu ar fi vizitarea, fotografierea și aflarea mai multor informații despre urangutanii din Borneo.
mt: Organized nature tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural environments to enjoy the scenery, including wild animals and vegetation. Examples of ground activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, as well as visiting parks and studying information about ecosystems. An example would be visiting, photographing, and learning more about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: În fiecare dimineață, oamenii pleacă cu mașina din așezările mici de la țară, pentru a se îndrepta spre locurile lor de muncă, trecând pe lângă alții a căror destinație de lucru este locul pe care tocmai l-au părăsit. În această navetă de transport dinamic, toată lumea are cumva legătură cu și susține un sistem de transport bazat pe mașini private. Știința indică acum că această economie bazată masiv pe carbon a dislocat biosfera dintr-una din stările sale stabile, care a susținut evoluția umană în ultimele 2 milioane de ani.
mt: Every morning, people leave their cars from small rural settlements, to head to their workplaces, passing by others whose destination is the place they just left. In this dynamic commute, everyone has somehow a connection with and supports a system of transport based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon-based economy has displaced the biosphere from one of its stable states, which has supported human evolution for the last 2 million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atomul poate fi considerat ca fiind unul dintre elementele fundamentale ale oricărei materii. Este o entitate foarte complexă care constă, conform unui model Bohr simplificat, dintr-un nucleu central în jurul căruia orbitează electronii, asemănător felului în care plantele orbitează în jurul soarelui – a se vedea Figura 1.1. Nucleul este format din 2 particule - neutroni și protoni. Protonii au o sarcină electrică pozitivă, în timp ce neutronii nu au sarcină. Electronii au o sarcină electrică negativă.
mt: The atom can be considered one of the fundamental elements of any matter. It is a very complex entity that consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus around which electrons orbit, similar to the way in which planets orbit around the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus is made up of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Practic, toate calculatoarele folosite în ziua de astăzi au la bază manipularea informației codificate sub forma numerelor binare. Un număr binar poate să conțină doar una dintre cele două valori, respectiv 0 sau 1, iar denumirea acestor numere este de cifre binare sau biți, în jargonul informaticii.
mt: Practically, all computers used today are based on the manipulation of information encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can only contain one of the two values, either 0 or 1, and the name of these numbers is binary digits or bits, in the jargon of informatics.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Blogurile pot de asemenea îmbunătăți exprimarea în scris a studentului. În timp ce studenții adesea își încep experiența de blogging cu gramatică și ortografie neglijente, existența unei audiențe are, în general, darul de a schimba situația. Dat fiind că studenții studenții reprezintă adeseori publicul cel mai critic, autorul blogului începe să facă eforturi pentru a-și îmbunătăți scrierea și pentru a evita criticile. „De asemenea, bloggingul «îi obligă pe studenți să fie mai conștienți de lumea înconjurătoare». Nevoia de a răspunde intereselor audienței lor îi inspiră pe studenți să fie isteți și interesanți (Toto, 2004).” Bloggingul este un instrument care stimulează colaborarea și îi încurajează pe studenți să-și extindă studiul mult dincolo de ziua școlară obișnuită. „Utilizarea adecvată a blogurilor «îi poate ajuta pe studenți să gândească mai analitic și mai critic; răspunzând activ la materialele găsite pe Internet, studenții își pot defini poziția în contextul celor scrise de alții, precum și contura propriile perspective cu privire la anumite probleme» (Oravec, 2002).”
mt: 1. Blogs can also improve a student's written expression. While students often begin their blogging experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the existence of an audience usually has the gift of changing that. Given that students often represent the most critical audience, the blog author begins to make efforts to improve his or her writing and to avoid criticism. “Blogging also ‘forces students to be more aware of the world around them.’ The need to respond to the interests of their audience inspires students to be smart and interesting (Toto, 2004).” Blogging is a tool that encourages collaboration and inspires students to extend their studies far beyond the usual school day. “Appropriate use of blogs ‘can help students to think more analytically and critically; responding actively to materials found on the Internet, students can define their position in the context of what others have written, as well as contour their own perspectives on certain issues’ (Oravec, 2002).”
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Comunicarea asincronă încurajează timpul de reflecție și de reacție față de alții. Le oferă elevilor posibilitatea de a lucra în propriul ritm și de a controla ritmul informației de instruire. În plus, sunt mai puține restricții temporare, plus posibilitatea unui program de lucru flexibil. (Bremer, 1998) Folosirea Internetului și a World Wide Web-ului le permite studenților accesul la informație în orice moment. De asemenea, studenții pot în orice moment al zilei trimite întrebări instructorilor și se pot aștepta la răspunsuri destul de rapide, mai degrabă decât să aștepte până la următoarea întâlnire față în față.
mt: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and response to others. It gives students the opportunity to work at their own pace and control the pace of information instruction. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions, plus the possibility of a flexible work schedule. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students access to information at any time. In addition, students can at any time of the day send questions to instructors and expect fairly quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Castelul medieval tradițional a inspirat multă vreme imaginația, evocând imagini de turniruri, banchete și cavalerie arturiană. Simplul act de a sta în mijlocul ruinelor milenare este suficient pentru a ne putea imagina sunetele și mirosurile bătăliilor demult trecute, și aproape că putem auzi tropăitul copitelor pe pavaj și simți spaima izvorând din temnițele subterane. Dar imaginația noastră se bazează oare pe realitate? De ce au fost construite castelele în primul rând? Cum au fost proiectate și construite?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, evoking images of tournaments, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. The simple act of standing in the midst of the ruins is enough to allow us to imagine the sounds and smells of battles long past, and almost we can hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and feel the fear emanating from the subterranean dungeons. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: O construcție tipică perioadei, Castelul Kirby Muxloe este mai degrabă o casă fortificată decât un castel adevărat. Ferestrele sale largi cu geamuri de sticlă și zidurile subțiri nu i-ar fi permis să reziste mult timp unui atac decisiv. În anii 1480, când Lord Hastings a început construcțiile, țara era destul de liniștită și era necesar să se ia măsuri de apărare doar împotriva unor mici bande de bandiți.
mt: A typical building of the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large windows with glass panes and thin walls would not have allowed it to withstand a serious attack for long. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began construction, the country was relatively peaceful and only minor bands of outlaws needed to be defended against.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Odată cu trecerea de la cursa de un sfert la cea de jumătate de milă, viteza devine mult mai puțin importantă, iar rezistența devine o necesitate absolută. Bineînțeles, un atlet de primă clasă în cursa de jumătate de milă, unul care poate parcurge distanța în mai puțin de două minute, trebuie să aibă o viteză rezonabilă, dar trebuie, cu orice preț, să se antreneze pentru rezistență. Câteva alergări de fond în timpul iernii, în combinație lucrarea parții superioare a corpului, reprezintă cea mai bună pregătire pentru sezonul de alergare.
mt: Once the race moves from the quarter mile to the half mile, speed becomes much less important, and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course, a top-class half-miler, one who can run the distance in less than two minutes, must have a reasonable speed, but must, at all costs, train for endurance. A few distance runs during the winter, in combination with the working of the upper part of the body, represents the best preparation for the racing season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Practicile nutriționale adecvate nu pot genera de unele singure performanțe notabile, dar pot afecta în mod semnificativ starea generală de sănătate a tinerilor sportivi. Păstrarea unui echilibru energetic sănătos, adoptarea de obiceiuri eficiente de hidratare și înțelegerea aspectelor diverse ale suplimentelor alimentare îi pot ajuta pe sportivi să-și îmbunătățească performanța și să-și sporească plăcerea practicării sportului.
mt: Appropriate nutritional practices cannot by themselves generate notable performances, but they can significantly affect the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, adopting efficient hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of dietary supplements can help athletes improve their performance and enjoy their sport more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Alergarea pe distanțe medii este un sport relativ ieftin; cu toate acestea, există multe concepții greșite cu privire la puținele piese de echipament necesare pentru a participa. Produsele pot fi achiziționate după nevoie, dar majoritatea vor avea un impact real redus sau inexistent asupra performanței. Atleții pot simți că preferă un produs, chiar și când acesta nu aduce niciun beneficiu real.
mt: Middle-distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions about the few pieces of equipment necessary to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have a real impact or none at all on performance. Athletes may feel they prefer a product, even when it brings no real benefit.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: RMN se bazează pe un fenomen fizic numit rezonanță magnetică nucleară (RMN), descoperită în anii 1930 de către Felix Blich (care lucra la Universitatea Stanford) și Edward Purcell (de la Universitatea Harvard). În această rezonanță, câmpul magnetic și undele radio determină atomii să emită semnale radio minuscule. În anul 1970, Raymond Damadian, medic și cercetător, a descoperit elementele de bază pentru utilizarea imagisticii prin rezonanță magnetică ca instrument de diagnostic medical. Patru ani mai târziu, a fost emis un brevet care reprezintă primul brevet la nivel mondial în domeniul imagisticii prin RMN. În 1977, Dr. Damadian a încheiat construcția primului scaner RMN pentru „tot corpul”, pe care l-a botezat „Indomitable”.
mt: MRI is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (who worked at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, the magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a physician and researcher, discovered the basic elements for using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, a patent was issued that represents the first worldwide patent in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed construction of the first whole-body MRI scanner, which he named "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Oamenii sunt de departe specia cea mai talentată la citirea gândurilor altora. Aceasta înseamnă că suntem capabili să prezicem cu succes ceea ce alte ființe umane percep, intenționează, cred, știu sau doresc. Printre aceste abilități, înțelegerea intențiilor altora este esențială. Ne permite să rezolvăm eventualele ambiguități ale acțiunilor fizice. Spre exemplu, dacă ai vedea pe cineva spărgând geamul unei mașini, probabil ai presupune că încearcă să fure mașina cuiva. Raționamentul ar trebui să fie altul în situația în care și-a pierdut cheile și ar fi încercat să intre în propria sa mașină.
mt: People are far and away the most talented species at reading the minds of others. This means that we are able to successfully predict what other human beings perceive, intend, believe, know, or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intentions of others is essential. It allows us to resolve any ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you saw someone smashing the window of a car, you would probably assume that they were trying to steal someone's car. The reasoning should be different in the situation where they had lost their keys and were trying to enter their own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

Printre aceste abilități, înțelegerea intențiilor altora este esențială. Ne permite să rezolvăm eventualele ambiguități ale acțiunilor fizice. Spre exemplu, dacă ai vedea pe cineva spărgând geamul unei mașini, probabil ai presupune că încearcă să fure mașina cuiva. Raționamentul ar trebui să fie altul în situația în care și-a pierdut cheile și ar fi încercat să intre în propria sa mașină.
mt: People are far and away the most talented species at reading the minds of others. This means that we are able to successfully predict what other human beings perceive, intend, believe, know, or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intentions of others is essential. It allows us to resolve any ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you saw someone smashing the window of a car, you would probably assume that they were trying to steal someone's car. The reasoning should be different in the situation where they had lost their keys and were trying to enter their own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Cu toată că IA are conotații puternice de science fiction, IA este o parte foarte importantă a informaticii, care se ocupă cu comportamentul, învățarea și adaptarea inteligenței la mașini. Cercetarea în IA presupune fabricarea de mașini pentru automatizarea sarcinilor care necesită un comportament inteligent. Exemplele includ controlul, planificarea și programarea, abilitatea de a răspunde la diagnosticele și întrebările clienților, precum și recunoașterea scrisului de mână, a vocii și a feței. Astfel de acțiuni au devenit discipline separate, care se concentrează pe oferirea de soluții la problemele vieții reale. Sistemul AI este acum adesea utilizat în domeniile economiei, medicinei, ingineriei și militar, dar a fost folosit și câteva aplicații software pentru calculatoare personale și jocuri video.
mt: While AI has strong connotations of science fiction, AI is a very important part of computer science, which deals with the behavior, learning and adaptation of machine intelligence. Research in AI involves building machines that automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to respond to customer diagnostics and questions, as well as handwriting, voice and face recognition. Such actions have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real-life problems. The AI system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and military, but has been used in a few software applications for personal computers and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Modelele de gândire convergente sunt tehnici de rezolvare a problemelor care aduc împreună diferite idei sau domenii, cu scopul de a găsi o soluție. Acest tip de gândire pune accentul pe viteză, logică și acuratețe, precum și identificarea faptelor, aplicarea tehnicilor deja existente, colectarea de informații. Cel mai semnificativ aspect al acestei mentalități este că există un singur răspuns corect. Îți imaginezi că există doar două răspunsuri, anume corect sau greșit. Acest gen de abordare este asociat cu anumite discipline științifice sau proceduri standard. Oamenii cu un astfel de tip de gândire gândesc logic, pot memora tipare, rezolva probleme și lucra la teste științifice.
mt: Convergent thinking is a problem-solving technique that brings together different ideas or domains with the goal of finding a solution. This type of thinking emphasizes speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as identifying facts, applying existing techniques, collecting information. The most significant aspect of this mindset is that there is only one correct answer. You can imagine that there are only two answers, either correct or incorrect. This approach is associated with certain scientific disciplines or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking think logically, can memorize patterns, solve problems, and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Folosirea înregistrărilor video a dus la descoperiri importante în interpretarea micro expresiilor, a mișcărilor faciale care durează câteva milisecunde. În special, se susține faptul că se poate observa dacă o persoană minte prin interpretarea corectă a microexpresiilor faciale. Oliver Sacks, în lucrarea sa „Discursul președintelui”, a arătat cum persoanele care nu pot înțelege vorbirea din cauza unor daune cerebrale reușesc totuși să evalueze cu acuratețe sinceritatea. El sugerează, chiar, că astfel de abilități de a interpreta comportamentul uman pot fi împărtășite de animale precum câinii domestici.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of microexpressions, facial movements that last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can observe whether a person is lying by correctly interpreting microexpressions. Oliver Sacks, in his book "The President's Speech", showed how people who cannot understand speech due to brain damage are nevertheless able to accurately evaluate sincerity. He even suggests that such abilities to interpret human behavior can be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Pe măsură ce capacitatea de a obține cunoștințe și de a învăța s-a schimbat în modurile menționate mai sus, viteza de bază a acumurării cunoștințelor s-a schimbat. Abordarea pentru obținerea de informații a fost diferită. Presiunea nu mai exista în memoria individuală, ci abilitatea de a-și aminti un text a devenit punctul central. În esență, Renașterea a adus o schimbare semnificativă în abordarea învățării și răspândirea cunoașterii.
mt: As the ability to obtain knowledge and learn changed in the ways mentioned above, the rate of accumulation of knowledge changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. Pressure no longer existed in individual memory, but the ability to remember a text became the central point. In essence, the Renaissance brought a significant change in the approach to learning and the spread of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internetul combină elemente de comunicație în masă și interpersonală. Caracteristicile distincte alte Internetului introduc dimensiuni suplimentare în ceea ce privește abordarea tipurilor de utilizări și a satisfacției. De exemplu, „învățarea” și „socializarea” sunt sugerate ca fiind motivații importante pentru folosirea internetului (James et al., 1995). „Implicarea personală” și „relațiile continue” au fost, de asemenea, identificate ca noi aspecte ale motivației de către Eighmey și McCord (1998), atunci când au investigat reacțiile publicului la site-urile web.
mt: Internet combines elements of mass communication and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet introduce additional dimensions in the approach to the types of uses and satisfaction. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are suggested as important motivations for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). "Personal involvement" and "continuous relationships" have also been identified as new aspects of motivation by Eighmey and McCord (1998), when they investigated the public's reactions to web sites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Stilul gotic și-a atins apogeul în perioada dintre secolele X - XI și în secolul al XIV-lea. La început, vestimentația a fost puternic influențată de cultura bizantină orientală. Totuși, din cauza canalelor de comunicare lente, stilurile din vest pot fi cu 25 până la 30 de ani în urmă. Spre sfârșitul Evului Mediu, Europa occidentală a început să-și dezvolte propriul stil. Unul dintre cele mai importante progrese din acea perioadă a fost că, în urma cruciadelor, oamenii au început să folosească nasturi pentru închiderea îmbrăcămintei.
mt: Gothic fashion reached its peak between the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th century. At first, clothing was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture of the Orient. However, due to slow communication channels, styles in the west can be up to 25 to 30 years behind. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the most important advances in that period was that, after the Crusades, people began to use buttons to close their clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Putem începe să trăim într-un mod mai prietenos cu mediul înconjurător, ne putem alătura mișcării ecologiste și putem chiar să devenim activiști pentru a reduce într-o oarecare măsură suferința viitoare. Acesta este la fel ca tratamentul simptomatic în multe cazuri. Cu toate acestea, dacă nu dorim doar o soluție temporară, atunci ar trebui să găsim rădăcina problemelor și ar trebui să le dezactivăm. Este evident că lumea s-a schimbat mult ca rezultat al progreselor științifice și tehnologice, iar problemele sunt mai mari acum din cauza suprapopulării și a stilului de viață extravagant al omenirii.
mt: We can start living in a more environmentally friendly way, we can join the environmental movement and we can even become activists to reduce suffering in some way. This is like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we don't just want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems and deactivate them. It is obvious that the world has changed a lot as a result of scientific and technological progress, and the problems are bigger now because of overpopulation and the extravagant lifestyle of mankind.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Echilibrul de putere era un sistem prin care națiunile europene căutau să mențină suveranitatea națională a tuturor statelor europene. Idea era că toate națiunile europene trebuiau să urmărească să prevină ca o națiune să devină puternică, și astfel, guvernele naționale își schimbau deseori alianțele, pentru a menține echilibrul. Războiul Spaniol de Succesiune a fost primul război a cărui problemă centrală a fost reprezentată de echilibrul puterilor. Aceasta a marcat o schimbare importantă, deoarece puterile europene nu vor mai avea pretextul să ducă războaie religioase. Astfel, Războiul de 30 de ani ar fi ultimul război care va fi etichetat război religios.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system by which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The idea was that all European nations should seek to prevent any nation from becoming too powerful, and thus, national governments would often change alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war whose central issue was represented by the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have pretext to wage religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: În timpul acestei perioade din istoria europeană, Biserica Catolică, care devenise bogată și puternică, a atras atenția asupra sa. Pentru mai mult de o mie de ani, religia creștină a legat statele europene unele de altele, în ciuda diferențelor de limbă și obiceiuri. Puterea sa omniprezentă i-a afectat pe toți, de la rege la muritor de rând. Unul dintre principalele principii creștine este că averea ar trebui să fie folosită pentru a ușura suferința și sărăcia și că fondurile monetare ale bisericii există în mod specific pentru acest motiv. Autoritatea centrală a bisericii era de peste o mie de ani în Roma, iar această concentrare a puterii și banilor i-a făcut pe mulți să-și pună întrebarea dacă principiul era într-adevăr respectat.
mt: During this period in European history, the Catholic Church, which had become wealthy and powerful, attracted attention to itself. For more than a thousand years, the Christian religion had bound the European states together, despite differences in language and custom. Its omnipresent power affected everyone, from king to commoner. One of the main Christian principles is that wealth should be used to ease suffering and poverty, and that the church's monetary funds exist specifically for this purpose. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money made many people question whether the principle was truly being respected.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: La 6 octombrie 1789, înspăimântatul rege Ludovic al XVI-lea, regina Maria Antoaneta, cei doi copii ai lor (Marie Thérèse de 11 ani și Louis-Charles de patru ani) și sora regelui, Madame Élisabeth, au fost forțați de către o mulțime formată din negustorese să se întoarcă de la Versailles la Paris. S-au deplasat înapoi spre Paris într-o trăsură, înconjurați de o mulțime strigând și urlând amenințări la adresa regelui și reginei. Mulțimea i-a silit pe Rege și pe Regină să lase larg deschise ferestrele trăsurii. La un moment dat, cineva din mulțime a ridicat capul unui membru al gărzii regale, ucis la Versailles în fața ochilor reginei înspăimântate.
mt: 6 October 1789, the terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two children (Marie Thérèse aged 11 and Louis-Charles aged 4) and the king's sister, Madame Élisabeth, were forced by a mob of market women to return from Versailles to Paris. They returned to Paris in a carriage, surrounded by a mob shouting and threatening the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to leave the carriage windows open. At one point, someone in the mob raised the head of a member of the royal guard, killed at Versailles in front of the queen's terrified eyes.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: La scurt timp după începea ostilităților, Marea Britanie a inițiat o blocadă navală a Germaniei. Strategia s-a dovedit eficientă, întrerupând furnizarea de provizii militare și civile vitale, deși această blocadă a încălcat prevederile de drept internațional general acceptate, înscrise în mai multe acorduri internaționale semnate în ultimele două secole. Marea Britanie a minat apele internaționale pentru a împiedica intrarea oricăror nave în întregi zone de ocean, punând în pericol chiar și navele neutre. Răspunsul la această tactică fiind rezervat, Germania s-a așteptat la o reacție similară în cazul războiului său submarin neînfrânat.
mt: Shortly after hostilities began, the United Kingdom initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, interrupting the supply of vital military and civilian provisions, although this blockade violated general accepted international law, enshrined in several international agreements signed in the last two centuries. The United Kingdom mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire ocean zones, endangering even neutral vessels. The response to this tactic was reserved, and Germany expected a similar response in the case of its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: În Statele Unite ale Americii, există aproape 400.000 de cazuri de Scleroză Multiplă (SM) cunoscute, aceasta însemnând că e cea mai întâlnită boală neurologică la adulții tineri și de vârstă mijlocie. SM este o boală care afectează sistemul nervos central, care este alcătuit din creier, măduva spinării și nervul optic. Cercetările au arătat că femeile au o probabilitate de două ori mai mare decât bărbații de a dezvolta SM.
mt: 400,000 cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) are known in the United States, meaning it is the most common neurological disease in young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve. Research has shown that women have a two-fold greater chance of developing MS than men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Concluzia studiului a fost că depresia, frica și atitudinea catastrofică mediază legătura dintre durere și handicap la cei suferind de dureri de spate. Doar efectele catastrofizării, nu depresia și teama, au fost condiționate de sesiuni de AF structurate săptămânal în mod regular. Cei care luau parte în mod regulat la activități fizice au avut nevoie de mai mult sprijin în termeni de percepție negativă a durerii, distingând între durere cronică și senzația de disconfort datorată activității fizice normale.
mt: The study concluded that depression, fear and catastrophic thinking mediated the link between pain and disability in those suffering from back pain. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear, were conditioned by structured weekly AF sessions. Those who participated in regular physical activity needed more support in terms of negative pain perception, distinguishing between chronic pain and the discomfort caused by normal physical activity.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Scrima, ca sport modern, este practicată la multe niveluri, de la studenți care o învață în cadrul unei universități, la competiții profesionale și olimpice. Sportul este practicat sub forma unui duel, un scrimer duelându-se cu celălalt.
mt: Fencing, as a modern sport, is practiced at many levels, from students who learn it at a university, to professional and Olympic competitions. The sport is practiced in the form of a duel, a fencer dueling with another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Otrăvirea internă ar putea să nu fie evidentă imediat. Simptomele, precum vomitatul, sunt suficient de generale încât un diagnostic imediat să nu poată fi pus. Cel mai bun indiciu pentru o otrăvire internă poate fi prezența unui recipient deschis de medicamente sau de produse chimice toxice de uz casnic. Consultați eticheta pentru instrucțiuni de prim ajutor în privința acelei otrăvi anume.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately evident. Symptoms, such as vomiting, are general enough that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indicator for internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or household chemicals. Consult the label for first aid instructions for that poison specifically.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Pentru a Verifica victima trebuie, înainte de toate, să treceți în revistă zona pentru a vă asigura că sunteți în siguranță. Trebuie să observi poziția victimei în timp ce te apropii de el sau de ea și orice semnale de alarmă automate. Dacă te rănești în timp ce încerci să ajuți, poate că nu vei face decât să înrăutățești situația.
mt: 1. Check the area to ensure that you are safe. 2. Observe the victim's position as you approach and any automated warning signals. 3. If you are injured while trying to help, you may only make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: A avut multe efecte sociale și politice, precum adoptarea sistemului metric, trecerea de la un sistem absolutist la unul republican, naționalistl și convingerea că țara aparține poporului, nu unui singur conducător. De asemenea, după Revoluție bărbații au putut accede la toate ocupațiile, permițându-le celor mai ambițioși și talentați să aibă parte de succes. La fel și în cazul militarilor, deoarece în locul ierarhiei armate bazate pe clasă, acum se bazau pe calibru. Revoluția franceză, la rândul ei, a inspirat mulți alți muncitori oprimați din alte țări să pornească propriile revoluții.
mt: It had many social and political effects, such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from an absolute to a republican, nationalist and the belief that the country belonged to the people, not a single leader. Also, after the Revolution men were allowed to access all occupations, allowing the most ambitious and talented to succeed. The same was true for the military, as the hierarchy based on class was replaced by one based on rank. The French Revolution, in turn, inspired many other oppressed workers in other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Toți participă în societate și folosesc sisteme de transport. Aproape toți se plâng cu privire la sistemele de transport. În țările dezvoltate se întâlnesc rar niveluri similare de nemulțumire cu privire la calitatea apei sau la prăbușirea de poduri. De ce oare sistemele de transport dau naștere la astfel de nemulțumiri, de ce eșuează zi de zi? Să fie oare pentru că inginerii de transporturi sunt pur și simplu incompetenți? Sau se întâmplă ceva mai grav?
mt: 99% of the population participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost all of them complain about the transportation systems. In developed countries, similar levels of dissatisfaction with water quality or bridge collapses are rare. Why do transportation systems cause such dissatisfaction, why do they fail every day? Are transportation engineers simply incompetent? Or is something more serious happening?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Fluxul traficului studiază mișcarea șoferilor și vehiculelor individuale între două puncte și felul în care aceștia interacționează între ei. Studierea fluxului traficului este din păcate dificilă, deoarece comportamentul șoferilor nu poate fi prezis cu precizie absolută. Din fericire, comportamentul conducătorilor tinde să rămână între limite rezonabil de constante; ca urmare, fluxurile de trafic tind să fie rezonabil de constante și pot fi aproximate matematic. Pentru a reprezenta mai bine fluxul de trafic, trebuie să stabilim relații între cele trei caracterisitici principale: (1) fluxul, (2) densitatea și (3) viteza. Aceste raporturi sunt utile pentru planificarea, proiectarea și operarea instalațiilor rutiere.
mt: Traffic flow studies the movement of drivers and individual vehicles between two points and how they interact with each other. Studying traffic flow is unfortunately difficult, because the behavior of drivers cannot be predicted with absolute precision. Fortunately, driver behavior tends to remain within reasonably constant limits; as a result, traffic flows tend to be reasonably constant and can be approximated mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, we must establish relationships between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships are useful for planning, designing, and operating road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Experimentul lui Hershey și Chase a reprezentat una dintre cele mai importante dovezi în favoarea ipotezei ADN-ul este material genetic. Hershey și Chase au folosit bacteriofagi, un tip de virusuri, pentru a-și implanta propriul ADN într-o bacterie. Au efectual două experimente marcând fie ADN-ul bacteriofagului cu fosfor radioactiv, fie proteinele acestuia cu sulf radioactiv.
mt: Hershey and Chase's experiment represented one of the most important evidence in favor of the hypothesis that DNA is genetic material. Hershey and Chase used bacteriophages, a type of viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They actually performed two experiments, marking either the bacteriophage's DNA with radioactive phosphorus, or its proteins with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutațiile pot avea o serie de efecte diferite, în funcție de tipul mutației, de semnificația piesei de material genetic afectat și dacă celulele afectate sunt celule germinale sau nu. Doar mutațiile din celulele de tipul liniei germinale pot fi transmise copiilor, în timp ce mutațiile din orice altă parte pot cauza moarte celulară sau cancer.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects, depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the affected piece of genetic material, and whether the affected cells are germline or not. Only mutations in germline cells can be transmitted to children, while mutations in any other part can cause cellular death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Caprele par a fi fost îmblânzite pentru prima dată acum aproximativ 10 000 de ani, în Munții Zagros din Iran. Culturile și triburile din vechime au începu să le țină pe lângă casă pentru a avea acces ușor la lapte, lână, carne și piei. Caprele domestice erau în general ținute în turme care cutreierau dealurile sau alte locuri de pășunat, de obicei în grija unor căprari care erau adesea copii sau adolescenți, similar cu bine cunoscuții oieri. Aceste metode de păstorit sunt folosite în continuare și în zilele noastre.
mt: Goats are believed to have been domesticated for the first time about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Cultures and tribes in ancient times began to keep them near the house for easy access to milk, wool, meat and skins. Domestic goats were usually kept in herds that roamed the hills or other grazing areas, often in the care of shepherds who were often children or adolescents, similar to the well-known sheepherders. These methods of herding are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golful este un joc în care jucătorii folosesc crose pentru a lovi mingi și a le introduce în găuri. Într-o rundă obișnuită sunt jucate optsprezece găuri, jucătorii începând de obicei cu prima gaură de pe teren și terminând cu a optsprezecea. Câștigă jucătorul care are nevoie de cele mai puține lovituri sau lovituri de crosă pentru a finaliza parcursul. Jocul se joacă pe iarbă, iarba din jurul găurii fiind tunsă mai scurt și numită „verdele”.
mt: A game in which players use mallets to hit balls and get them into holes. In a typical round, eighteen holes are played, players starting with the first hole on the course and ending with the eighteenth. The player who needs the fewest strokes or mallet hits to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, the grass around the hole being cut shorter and called "greens".
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

mt: A game in which players use mallets to hit balls and get them into holes. In a typical round, eighteen holes are played, players starting with the first hole on the course and ending with the eighteenth. The player who needs the fewest strokes or mallet hits to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, the grass around the hole being cut shorter and called "greens".
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Principalul scop al științei este de a-și da seama cum funcționează lumea, folosind metoda științifică. Această metodă este aplicată în majoritatea cercetărilor științifice. Nu este singurul totuși, experimentarea și un experiment reprezintă un test utilizat pentru a elimina una sau mai multe dintre ipotezele posibile, adresarea de întrebări și efectuarea de observații ghidează, de asemenea, cercetarea științifică.
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works, using the scientific method. This method is applied in most scientific research. It is not the only one though, experimentation and an experiment represent a test used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, addressing questions and making observations guide scientific research as well.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornadele afectează arii puțin extinse comparativ cu alte furtuni violente, dar pot nimici orice le stă în drum. Tornadele scot copacii din rădăcini, smulg scândurile clădirilor și ridică mașini în aer. Două procente din cele mai violente tornade durează peste trei ore. Aceste furtuni monstruoase au vânturi care ajung până la 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes affect small areas compared to other violent storms, but can destroy anything in their path. Tornadoes rip trees from their roots, tear off shingles from buildings and lift cars into the air. Two percent of the most violent tornadoes last more than three hours. These monstrous storms have winds that reach up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Omenii realizează și folosesc lentile pentru mărire de mii și mii de ani. Cu toate acestea, primele telescoape adevărate au fost realizate în Europa la sfârșitul secolului al XVI-lea. Aceste telescoape foloseau un sistem format din 2 lentile pentru a face ca obiectele din depărtare se pară mai apropiate și mai mari.
mt: People have been using magnifying lenses for thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. These telescopes used a system of two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
