src: Mohamed era profund interesat de lucruri care treceau dincolo de cele lumești. El obișnuia să meargă des pentru a medita într-o peșteră care ajuns să fie cunoscută sub numele de „Hira”, aflată pe Muntele „Noor” (lumină). Peștera în sine, care a supraviețuit de-a lungul timpului, ne permite să ne formăm o imagine vie despre înclinațiile spirituale ale lui Mahomed. Aflată în vârful unuia dintre munții de la nord de Mecca, peștera este complet izolată de restul lumii. De fapt, este greu de găsit chiar atunci când îi cunoști existența. Odată ajuns înăuntrul peșterii, ești complet izolat. Singurele lucruri care se pot vedea sunt cerul limpede și frumos de deasupra și munții de jur împrejur. Foarte puțin din lumea aceasta poate fi întrevăzut sau auzit din interiorul peșterii.
mt: Mohammed was deeply interested in things that went beyond the earthly. He used to go often to meditate in a cave that came to be known as “Hira”, located on the Mount “Noor” (light). The cave itself, which has survived through the ages, allows us to form a vivid picture of Mohammed’s spiritual inclinations. Located at the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is hard to find even when you know it exists. Once inside the cave, you are completely isolated. The only things that can be seen are the clear and beautiful sky above and the mountains all around. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Drumuri de tipul wagonway au fost construite în Anglia încă din secolul al XVI-lea. Cu toate că aceste wagonways constau doar din scânduri de lemn dispuse în paralel, le-au permis cailor să atingă viteze mai mari și să tragă încărcături mai grele decât o puteau face pe drumurile puțin mai neregulate din acea vreme. Traversele au fost introduse destul de timpuriu, pentru a menține șinele la locul lor. Cu toate acestea, treptat, s-a ajuns la concluzia că șinele ar fi mai eficiente dacă ar avea o bandă metalică deasupra. Aceasta a devenit o practică răspândită, însă fierul a dus la uzarea mai rapidă a roților de lemn ale vagoanelor. În cele din urmă, roțile de lemn au fost înlocuite cu roți de fier. În 1767, au fost produse primele șine fabricate în întregime din fier.
mt: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th century. Although these wagonways consisted only of planks laid parallel, they allowed horses to reach higher speeds and pull heavier loads than they could on the less regular roads of the time. Cross-ties were introduced fairly early on, to keep the rails in place. However, it was eventually concluded that rails would be more efficient if they had a metal band above them. This became a common practice, but the iron led to faster wear of the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced with iron wheels. In 1767, the first fully iron rails were produced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: O componentă importantă a romanticismului a fost determinismul cultural, împrumutat de la scriitori precum Goethe, Fichte și Schlegel. În contextul romantismului, geografia a modelat indivizii și, de-a lungul timpului, au apărut obiceiuri și culturi legate de acea geografie, iar acestea, fiind în armonie cu locul ocupat de societate, au fost mai bune decât legile impuse arbitrar.
mt: An important component of romanticism was cultural determinism, borrowed from writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. In the context of romanticism, geography shaped individuals and, over time, customs and cultures tied to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the society's place, were better than arbitrary laws imposed.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Determinismul tehnologic este un termen care cuprinde o gamă largă de idei în practică, de la presiunea tehnologică sau imperativul tehnologic, la un sens strict că destinul uman este condus de o logică aferentă, asociată cu legile științifice și manifestarea lor în tehnologie. „Cele mai multe interpretări ale determinismului tehnologic împărtășesc două idei generale: că dezvoltarea tehnologică în sine urmează o cale în mare parte în afara influenței culturale și politice și că tehnologia, la rândui ei, are «efecte» asupra societății care sunt inerente mai degrabă decât condiționate social.” De exemplu, s-ar putea spune că mașina duce în mod necesar la dezvoltarea drumurilor. Cu toate acestea, o rețea rutieră la nivel național nu este viabilă din punct de vedere economic pentru doar o mână de mașini, așa că noi metode de producție sunt dezvoltate pentru a reduce costurile de proprietate ale mașinilor. Un număr mare proprietari de mașini duce la o incidență mărită a accidentelor pe drumurile publice, ceea ce determină inventarea de noi tehnici medicale pentru vindecarea vătămărilor corporale.
mt: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technological pressure or imperative of technology, to a strict sense that human destiny is guided by a logic associated with, pertaining to, scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. "Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that technological development itself follows a course largely outside of cultural and political influence and that technology, in turn, has 'effects' on society that are inherent rather than socially conditioned." For example, it could be said that the car leads necessarily to the development of roads. However, a national road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new production methods are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. A large number of car owners leads to a higher incidence of road accidents, which leads to the invention of new medical techniques for healing bodily injuries.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: „Marcajul «trăsătură în sus» arată ca un V, iar «marcajul «trăsătură în jos» arată ca o capsă sau un pătrat căruia îi lipsește latura de jos.” În sus înseamnă că trebuie să începeți de la vârf și să împingeți arcușul; în jos înseamnă că trebuie să începeți de la broască (adică în partea de care apucați arcușul cu mâna) și să trageți arcușul. O trăsătură de arcuș în sus generează de obicei un sunet mai blând, pe când o trăsătură în jos e mai puternică și mai hotărâtă. Nu ezitați să însemnați propriile indicații, dar amintiți-vă că indicațiile tipărite pentru trăsăturile de arcuș se află acolo din motive muzicale și în mod normal, trebuie respectate.
mt: “The ‘up-bow’ marking looks like a V, and the ‘down-bow’ marking looks like a box or square with the bottom side missing.” Up means you start at the tip and push the bow; down means you start at the frog (that is, the part of the bow you hold with your hand) and pull the bow. An up-bow tends to produce a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more decisive. Don’t hesitate to mark your own bowings, but remember that the printed bowings for bowings are there for musical reasons and should normally be followed.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Spre deosebire de alte primate, hominizii nu mai folosesc mâinile pentru deplasare, pentru susținerea greutății sau pentru a se lansa dintr-un copac în altul. Mâna și piciorul cimpanzeului sunt asemănătoare în mărime și lungime, și fac posibilă utilizarea mâinii pentru susținerea greutății în timpul mersului sprijinit în pumni. Mâna umană are lungimea mai mică decât laba piciorului și falangele mai drepte. Oase fosilizate ale mâinii, în vârstă de două până la trei milioane de ani, arată această schimbare a specializării mâinii dinspre locomoție spre manipulare.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands for locomotion, for supporting weight, or for leaping from one tree to another. The chimpanzee hand and foot are similar in size and length, allowing the hand to be used for supporting weight while walking on the knuckles. The human hand is shorter than the wrist of the foot and the fingers are straighter. Fossilized bones of the hand, dating back two to three million years, show this change in the specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Cercetările din secolul XX au arătat că există două grupuri de variație genetică: ascuns și exprimat. Mutațiile adaugă noi variații genetice, iar selecția le elimină din setul de variații exprimate. Separarea și recombinarea fac ca la fiecare generație direcția variației să fie dominată de unul sau altul dintre cele două fonduri genetice.
mt: 20th century research has shown that there are two groups of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutations add new genetic variations, and selection removes them from the set of expressed variations. Separation and recombination make it so that at each generation the direction of variation is dominated by one or the other of the two genetic pools.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: În savană, unei primate cu sistem digestiv similar celui al oamenilor îi este greu să-și satisfacă cerințele de aminoacizi din resursele vegetale disponibile. În plus, eșecul în a o face atrage consecințe grave: încetinirea creșterii, malnutriție și, în cele din urmă, moartea. Cele mai ușor accesibile resurse vegetale erau proteinele din frunze și leguminoase, dar acestea sunt greu de digerat pentru primatele ca noi dacă nu sunt gătite. Spre deosebire de acestea, hrana de origine animală (furnici, termite, ouă) este nu doar ușor de digerat, dar oferă și cantități mari de proteine care conțin toți aminoacizii esențiali. „Ținând cont de toate astea, n-ar trebui să ne surprindă dacă strămoșii noștri au rezolvat «problema proteinelor» într-un mod asemănător cu cimpanzeii din savanele zilelor noastre.”
mt: In the savanna, a primate with a digestive system similar to ours has a hard time meeting its amino acid requirements from available vegetable resources. In addition, failure to do so attracts serious consequences: stunted growth, malnutrition, and eventually death. The most easily accessible vegetable resources were proteins in leaves and legumes, but these are hard to digest for primates like us unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal-derived food (ants, termites, eggs) is not only easy to digest, but also provides large amounts of protein containing all essential amino acids. "Given all this, it should not surprise us if our ancestors solved the 'protein problem' in a similar way to the chimpanzees of the savannas today."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

Cele mai ușor accesibile resurse vegetale erau proteinele din frunze și leguminoase, dar acestea sunt greu de digerat pentru primatele ca noi dacă nu sunt gătite. Spre deosebire de acestea, hrana de origine animală (furnici, termite, ouă) este nu doar ușor de digerat, dar oferă și cantități mari de proteine care conțin toți aminoacizii esențiali. „Ținând cont de toate astea, n-ar trebui să ne surprindă dacă strămoșii noștri au rezolvat «problema proteinelor» într-un mod asemănător cu cimpanzeii din savanele zilelor noastre.”
mt: In the savanna, a primate with a digestive system similar to ours has a hard time meeting its amino acid requirements from available vegetable resources. In addition, failure to do so attracts serious consequences: stunted growth, malnutrition, and eventually death. The most easily accessible vegetable resources were proteins in leaves and legumes, but these are hard to digest for primates like us unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal-derived food (ants, termites, eggs) is not only easy to digest, but also provides large amounts of protein containing all essential amino acids. "Given all this, it should not surprise us if our ancestors solved the 'protein problem' in a similar way to the chimpanzees of the savannas today."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Subculturile adună laolaltă indivizi cu gândire similară, care se simt dați la o parte de standardele societății, permițându-le să-și dezvolte un simț al identității. Subculturile pot fi distincte datorită vârstei, etniei, clasei, locației și/sau sexului membrilor. Caracteristicile care disting o subcultură pot fi lingvistice, estetice, religioase, politice, sexuale, geografice sau o combinație de factori. Membrii unei subculturi își semnalează adesea calitatea de membru printr-o utilizare distinctă și simbolică a stilului caracteristic, care include moda, manierismele și argoul.
mt: Subcultures gather together individuals with similar thinking, who feel left out of society's standards, allowing them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinct due to the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or sex of members. Characteristics that distinguish a subculture can be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographic, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinct and symbolic use of the characteristic style, which includes fashion, mannerisms, and argot.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Copiii dezvoltă o conștiință rasială și stereotipuri rasiale de la o vârstă destul de fragedă și aceste stereotipuri rasiale afectează comportamentul. Spre exemplu, copiii care se identifică cu o minoritate rasială stereotipizată ca una care nu are rezultate bune la învățătură, tind să nu se descurce bine la școală, o dată ce află despre stereotipul asociat cu rasa lor.
mt: Children develop racial consciousness and racial stereotypes at a fairly young age and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For example, children who identify with a racial minority stereotyped as one that does not do well in school tend to do poorly in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: Una dintre cele mai comune metode folosite pentru a ilustra importanța socializării este aceea de a se inspira în câteva cazuri nefericite de copii care, în urma neglijenței, nenorocirii sau abuz deliberat, nu au fost socializați de către adulți în timp ce creșteau. „Astfel de copii sunt numiți «neîmblânziți» sau sălbatici. Unii copii sălbatici au fost sechestrați de oameni (de regulă de către propriii părinți); în unele cazuri, abandonul copilului s-a datorat respingerii lui de către părinți, din cauza unor deficiențe intelectuale sau fizice severe.” E posibil ca copiii sălbăticiți să fi resimțit abuzuri sau traume severe înainte de fi abandonați sau de a fugi de acasă. Despre unii se crede că au fost crescuți de animale; iar despre alții se spune că au trăit singuri în sălbăticie. Copilul sălbatic, când este crescut în totalitate de animale non-umane, prezintă comportamente (în limitele sale fizice) aproape în totalitate ca cele ale animalului care l-a îngrijit, cum ar fi frica sau indiferența față de oameni.
mt: 1 of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is that of drawing inspiration from unfortunate cases of children who, due to neglect, misfortune, or deliberate abuse, were not socialized by adults while growing up. “Such children are called ‘feral’ or ‘wild’. Some feral children have been captured by people (usually by their own parents); in some cases, the child’s abandonment was due to his rejection by parents, because of severe intellectual or physical disabilities.” It is possible that feral children have experienced abuse or severe trauma before being abandoned or running away from home. Some are believed to have been raised by non-human animals, while others are said to have lived alone in the wild. The feral child, when raised entirely by non-human animals, presents behaviors (within its physical limits) almost entirely like that of the animal that raised it, such as fear or indifference towards humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Agricultura de subzistență este agricultura făcută pentru a produce alimente suficiente pentru a satisface doar nevoile agricultorului și ale familiei sale. Agricultura de subzistență este un sistem simplu, adesea ecologic, care folosește semințe păstrate, originare din aceeași regiune ecologică, alături de rotația culturilor sau alte tehnici relativ simple de a maximiza randamentul. Din punct de vedere istoric, majoritatea fermierilor se ocupau cu agricultura de subzistență și acest lucru se întâmplă încă în multe țări în curs de dezvoltare.
mt: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture done for the purpose of producing enough food to satisfy only the needs of the farmer and his family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often ecologically sound, system that uses saved seeds, originating from the same ecological region, along with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically, most farmers were involved in subsistence agriculture and this still happens in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Cel mai comun tip de turism este, poate, ceea ce majoritatea lumii asociază cu călătoria: turismul de agrement. Aceasta se întâmplă când lumea se deplasează pentru a se relaxa și distra într-un loc mult diferit de cele în care-și petrec viața de zi cu zi. Plajele, parcurile tematice și campingurile sunt deseori locurile cel mai frecventate de turiști pentru recreare. Dacă scopul vizitării unui anumit loc este de a se familiariza cu istoria și cultura sa, avem un tip de turism cunoscut ca turism cultural. Turiștii pot face turul diverselor atracții turistice ale unei țări sau pot alege să se concentreze doar pe o singură zonă.
mt: The most common type of tourism is, perhaps, what most people associate with travel: recreational tourism. This happens when people travel to relax and have fun in a place very different from where they spend their daily lives. Beaches, theme parks and camping are often the most frequented places by tourists for recreation. If the purpose of visiting a particular place is to familiarize oneself with its history and culture, we have a type of tourism known as cultural tourism. Tourists can tour the various tourist attractions of a country or choose to focus only on a single area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Persoane implicate de-a lungul mai multor decenii ne-au ajutat să ne evaluăm punctele forte și pasiunile, apreciindu-ne în același timp cu sinceritate dificultățile și chiar eșecurile. Ascultând persoane care împărtășeau poveștile lor, ale familiilor și ale organizației, am obținut o perspectivă valoroasă asupra trecutului și a unor personalități care au influențat în bine sau în rău cultura organizației. Chiar dacă înțelegerea trecutului nu presupune neapărat înțelegerea culturii, îi ajută măcar pe oameni să-și facă o idee despre poziția în care se încadrează în istoria organizației. Evaluând succesele și conștientizând eșecurile, persoanele și întregile grupuri participante aprofundează valorile, misiunea și forțele directoare ale organizației. În această situați, reamintirea instanțelor anterioare de comportament antreprenorial și a succeselor avute ca rezultat a fost de ajutor oamenilor pentru a fi deschiși deschiși la schimbare și spre o nouă orientare a bisericii locale. Astfel de povești de succes au atenuat temerile legate de schimbare, creând în același timp înclinații pozitive spre schimbare în viitor.
mt: People involved over many decades have helped us to evaluate our strengths and passions, while at the same time being honest about the difficulties and even failures. Listening to people who shared their stories, of families and of the organization, we gained a valuable perspective on the past and on personalities who have influenced the organization for good or ill. While understanding the past does not necessarily mean understanding the culture, it at least helps people to get an idea of where they stand in the organization's history. Evaluating successes and acknowledging failures, people and entire groups participating aprofundize the values, mission and guiding forces of the organization. In this situation, reminding of previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and of successes resulting from them was helpful to people to be open to change and to a new orientation of the local church. Such success stories attenuated fears about change, while at the same time creating positive inclinations towards change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Abordarea postmodernistă a învățăturii oferă eliberarea de absoluturi. Nu există o singură modalitate bună de a învăța. De fapt, nu există un singur lucru de învățat. Învățarea are loc prin experiența pe care o are cel care învață cu informațiile prezentate. Experiența noastră actuală, cu toate clipurile DIY și prezentarea de informații, cu emisiunile de educative de televiziune, ilustrează acest punct de vedere. Atâția dintre noi privesc emisiuni TV care ne oferă informații despre un proces sau experiență la care nu vom avea niciodată ocazia să luăm parte sau să ne punem în practică cunoștințele. Niciodată nu vom face revizia la o mașină, nu vom construi o fântână în curtea noastră, călători în Peru pentru a examina ruinele antice sau remodela casa vecinului nostru.
mt: The postmodern approach to teaching offers liberation from absolutes. There is no one right way to learn. In fact, there is nothing to learn. Learning happens through the experience of the learner with the information presented. Our current experience, with all the DIY videos and information presentation, with educational television shows, illustrates this point of view. So many of us watch TV shows that offer us information about a process or experience to which we will never have the opportunity to take part or put our knowledge into practice. We will never do a car inspection, build a fountain in our yard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins or remodel our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Întreruperea somnului este procedura prin care vă treziți intenționat în timpul perioadei normale de somn pentru a readormi după scurt timp (10-60 de minute). Acest lucru se poate face cu ușurință folosind un ceas cu alarmă relativ liniștit, pentru a vă a aduce într-o stare conștientă fără a vă trezi pe deplin. Dacă ți se întâmplă să resetezi ceasul deșteptător în somn, îl poți pune în cealaltă parte a încăperii, forțându-te să te dai jos din pat pentru a-l opri. Alte opțiuni bazate pe bioritm presupun băutul de lichide (în special apă sau ceai, care are efecte diuretice) înainte de culcare, obligându-ne să ne ridicăm din pat pentru a urina.
mt: Interrupted sleep is the procedure by which you wake yourself intentionally during the normal sleep period to re-drowse after a short time (10-60 minutes). This can be done easily using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you into a conscious state without fully waking up. If you happen to reset your alarm clock in sleep, you can put it on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to stop it. Other options based on biorhythm assume drinking liquids (especially water or tea, which has diuretic effects) before going to bed, forcing us to get out of bed to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Întreruperea somnului este procedura prin care vă treziți intenționat în timpul perioadei normale de somn pentru a readormi după scurt timp (10-60 de minute). Acest lucru se poate face cu ușurință folosind un ceas cu alarmă relativ liniștit, pentru a vă a aduce într-o stare conștientă fără a vă trezi pe deplin. Dacă ți se întâmplă să resetezi ceasul deșteptător în somn, îl poți pune în cealaltă parte a încăperii, forțându-te să te dai jos din pat pentru a-l opri. Alte opțiuni bazate pe bioritm presupun băutul de lichide (în special apă sau ceai, care are efecte diuretice) înainte de culcare, obligându-ne să ne ridicăm din pat pentru a urina.
mt: Interrupted sleep is the procedure by which you wake yourself intentionally during the normal sleep period to re-drowse after a short time (10-60 minutes). This can be done easily using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you into a conscious state without fully waking up. If you happen to reset your alarm clock in sleep, you can put it on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to stop it. Other options based on biorhythm assume drinking liquids (especially water or tea, which has diuretic effects) before going to bed, forcing us to get out of bed to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Unii cred că poate fi extrem de obositor să ai vise lucide induse artificial suficient de des. Acest fenomen apare în principal datorită faptului că visele lucide măresc durata dintre stările REM. Cu mai puține secvențe REM pe noapte, această stare în care aveți parte de somn propriu-zis și corpul se recuperează devine suficient de rară pentru a constitui o problemă. Este la fel de obositor ca și cum te-ai trezi la fiecare douăzeci sau treizeci de minute și te-ai uita la televizor. Efectul depinde de cât de des încearcă creierul să viseze lucid în cursul unei singure nopți.
mt: Some people think it can be extremely tiring to have lucid dreams induced artificially often enough. This phenomenon mainly occurs because lucid dreams increase the duration between REM cycles. With fewer REM cycles per night, this state in which you have your own sleep and the body recovers becomes rare enough to be a problem. It's as tiring as waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching TV. The effect depends on how often the brain tries to lucid dream in the course of a single night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Echipele virtuale fac obiectul acelorași standarde de excelență ca echipele tradiționale, dar există diferențe subtile. Membrii virtuali ai echipei adesea au rolul de a oferi un punct de contact pentru grupul fizic din care fac parte. De multe ori au mai multă autonomie decât membrii echipei convenționale, întrucât echipele lor se pot întâlni în funcție de fusuri orare diferite, care ar putea să nu fie înțelese de conducerea lor locală. Prezența unei adevărate „echipe invizibile” (Larson și LaFasto, 1989, p. 109) reprezintă, de asemenea, o componentă unică a unei echipe virtuale. „Echipa invizibilă” este echipa de management căreia îi dau raportul fiecare dintre membri. Echipa invizibilă stabilește standardele pentru fiecare dintre membri.
mt: Virtual teams are subject to the same standards of excellence as traditional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often have the role of providing a point of contact for the physical team they are part of. They often have more autonomy than traditional team members, as their teams can meet at different time zones, which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p. 109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The invisible team is the management team to which each member reports. The invisible team sets standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Teoriile conținutului sunt axate pe identificarea elementelor care atrag atenția oamenilor sau le fac plăcere. Aceste teorii sugerează că oamenii au anumite nevoi și/sau dorințe care sunt interiorizate odată cu dezvoltarea până la maturitate. Aceste teorii studiază ce îi determină pe unii să dorească să facă ceea ce fac și ce anume din mediul lor înconjurător poate determina facă sau să nu anumite lucruri. Două teorii populare privind conținutul sunt Teoria piramidei nevoilor a lui Maslow și Teoria celor doi factori a lui Herzberg.
mt: Content theories are focused on identifying elements that attract people's attention or give them pleasure. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires that are internalized as they develop to maturity. These theories study what determines some people to want to do what they do and what exactly in their surroundings can determine them to do or not do certain things. Two popular theories of content are Maslow's hierarchy of needs and Herzberg's two-factor theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Regula treimilor, mult abuzată și adesea ridiculizată, nu este altceva decât o simplă sugestie pentru a crea dinamism, menținând în același timp ceva ordine într-o imagine. Conform acesteia, locul cel mai bun pentru poziționarea subiectului principal este la intersecția liniilor care împart cadrul în treimi pe verticală și pe orizontală (a se vedea exemplul).
mt: The rule of thirds, often abused and ridiculed, is nothing more than a simple suggestion to create dynamism, while maintaining some order in an image. According to this, the best place for the main subject is at the intersection of the lines that divide the frame into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: De exemplu, cel mai obișnuit format static de fotografie din lume este de 35mm, care era mărimea dominantă de peliculă de la sfârșitul erei filmului analog. Este produs și în zilele noastre dar, mai important, proporțiile sale au fost preluate de formatele senzorului de imagine al camerei digitale. Formatul de 35 mm, oarecum derutant, este de fapt de 36 mm în lățime pe 24 mm în înălțime. Raportul de aspect al acestui format (împărțind la doisprezece pentru a obține cel mai simplu raport de număr întreg) este, prin urmare, declarat a fi 3:2. Multe formate obișnuite (de exemplu, familia de formate APS) sunt identice cu sau foarte apropiate de această proporție.
mt: 35mm is the most common static photo format in the world, and was the dominant film roll size at the end of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly, its proportions have been adopted by the image sensor format of the digital camera. The 35mm format, somewhat confusingly, is actually 36mm wide by 24mm high. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to get the simplest integer ratio) is therefore declared to be 3:2. Many common formats (such as the APS family) are identical to or very close to this proportion.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Dezavantajul obiectivelor zoom este că complexitatea procesului de focalizare și numărul de lentile necesar pentru a acoperi o gamă de distanțe focale sunt mult mai mari decât în cazul obiectivelor cu focalizare fixă. Aceasta este o problemă tot mai rară, dat fiind că producătorii de obiective ating standarde mai ridicate în fabricarea obiectivelor. Acest lucru a permis obiectivelor de tip zoom să producă imagini de o calitate comparabilă cu cea obținută de obiectivele cu distanță focală fixă. Un alt dezavantaj al lentilelor pentru zoom este acela că apertura maximă (viteza) a lentilei este de obicei mai mică. Din acest motiv, obiectivele zoom ieftine sunt dificil de folosit fără bliț în condiții de lumină slabă.
mt: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the complexity of the focusing process and the number of lenses required to cover a range of focal lengths are much greater than in fixed-focus lenses. This is a problem that is becoming increasingly rare, given that lens manufacturers are meeting higher standards in the manufacture of lenses. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce images of comparable quality to those obtained by fixed-focus lenses. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually smaller. For this reason, cheap zoom lenses are difficult to use without a flash in low light conditions.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Misticismul reprezintă căutarea comuniunii cu, identificării cu sau conștientizării unei realități finale, a divinului, a unui adevăr spiritual sau a lui Dumnezeu. Credincioșii sunt în căutarea unei experiențe directe, a unei intuiții, sau a unei pătrunderi în realitatea divină/a zeității sau zeilor. Adepții practică anumite moduri de viață sau practici care sunt menite să alimenteze acele experiențe. Misticismul se poate distinge de alte forme de credință și adorare religioasă prin accentul pus pe trăirea personală și directă a unei stări unice de conștiință, în special una cu caracter pașnic, de analiză interioară, fericire sau chiar extaz.
mt: Mysticism is the pursuit of direct, personal, and intimate experience of the divine, or of the "absolute", or "enlightenment", or "nirvana", or "salvation", or "theosis", or "God", or "unity with God", or "union with God", or "oneness with God", or "God-consciousness", or "Buddha-consciousness", or "Christ-consciousness", or "nirvana-consciousness", or "tathagata-consciousness", or "Brahman-consciousness", or "Atman-consciousness", or "Sachchidananda-consciousness", or "Moksha", or "Satori", or "Kensho", or "Nirvikalpa Samadhi", or "Asamprajanata Samadhi", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-yoku", or "Shinrin-yo", or "Shinrin-y
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Multă vreme, de-a lungul secolelor nouăsprezece și douăzeci, s-a crezut că primii locuitori ai Noii Zeelande au fost maori, care vânau păsări uriașe numite moa. Teoria a stabilit apoi ideea că poporul maori a migrat din Polinezia într-o mare flotă și a luat Noua Zeelandă din Moriori, înființând o societate agricolă. Cu toate acestea, noi dovezi sugerează că populația moriori era un grup de maori continentali, care au migrat din Noua Zeelandă pe Insulele Chatham, dezvoltându-și propria cultură specifică și pașnică. În insulele Chatham mai exista și un alt trib, alcătuit din maori care emigraseră departe de Noua Zeelandă. Își spuneau Moriori; după câteva, moriori au fost în cele din urmă șterși de pe fața pământului.
mt: For a long time, throughout the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori, who hunted giant birds called moa. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a large fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori population was a group of continental Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own specific and peaceful culture. There was also another tribe in the Chatham Islands, made up of Maori who emigrated far from New Zealand. They called themselves Moriori; after a few, Moriori were eventually wiped off the face of the earth.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Origami Pureland este tot origami, dar cu limitarea că se poate face un singur pliu la un moment dat, nu se pot face plieri mai complexe, cum ar fi cele inversate, și toate pliurile se fac în poziții evidente. A fost dezvoltat de John Smith în anii 1970, pentru a-i ajuta pe practicanții fără experiență și pe cei cu abilități motorii limitate.
mt: Origami Pureland is still origami, but with the limitation that only one fold can be made at a time, no complex folds such as reverses can be made, and all folds are made in obvious positions. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s, to help novices and those with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Origami Pureland este tot origami, dar cu limitarea că se poate face un singur pliu la un moment dat, nu se pot face plieri mai complexe, cum ar fi cele inversate, și toate pliurile se fac în poziții evidente. A fost dezvoltat de John Smith în anii 1970, pentru a-i ajuta pe practicanții fără experiență și pe cei cu abilități motorii limitate.
mt: Origami Pureland is still origami, but with the limitation that only one fold can be made at a time, no complex folds such as reverses can be made, and all folds are made in obvious positions. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s, to help novices and those with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Civilizația din Valea Indusului a fost o civilizație din epoca bronzului din zona de nord-vest a subcontinentului Indiei, care a cuprins majoritatea ariei Pakistanului din zilele noastre, alături de unele regiuni din nord-vestul Indiei și din nord-estul Afganistanului. Civilizația a înflorit la malul râului Indus, de la care i se trage și numele. Cu toate că unii cercetători speculează că, în condițiile în care civilizația a fost de asemenea prezentă în bazinul acum secat al Râului Sarasvati, ar fi mai corect să fie numită Civilizația Indus-Sarasvati, pe când alții o numesc Civilizația Harappa, numită după Harappa, primul sit unde a fost descoperită în săpături în cursul anilor 1920.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in the north-western regions of South Asia, lasting from the Neolithic to the Bronze Age. It flourished in the basin of the Indus River, which flows through the length of Pakistan and into India, and extends from Cholistan Desert to the Arabian Sea. It extended from Bhirrana in Haryana to the Makran coast alongside a semi-desert. The Indus Valley Civilization is also known as the Harappan Civilization, after the type site, Harappa, the first of its sites to be discovered. The Indus Valley Civilization is also known as the Harappan Civilization, after the type site, Harappa, the first of its sites to be discovered.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Lăcomia și egoismul vor fi întotdeauna cu noi și este în natura cooperării ca atunci când majoritatea profită, întotdeauna să se câștige mai mult pe termen scurt acționând în mod egoist. Din fericire majoritatea oamenilor vor realiza că cea mai bună opțiune pe termen lung pentru ei este să lucreze în colaborare cu alții.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is in the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefits, always to gain more in the short term by acting selfishly. Fortunately most people will realize that the best option in the long term for them is to work in collaboration with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Cheltuielile de război ale imperialismului Statelor Unite în cucerirea statului Filipine au fost plătite de către însuși poporul filipinez. Aceștia au fost obligați să plătească impozite regimului colonial american pentru a suporta o mare parte din cheltuieli și dobânzile aferente obligațiunilor puse în numele guvernului filipinez prin casele bancare de pe Wall Street. Bineînțeles, profiturile enorme de pe urma exploatării îndelungate a poporului filipinez au constituit câștigul de bază al imperialismului american.
mt: The war expenses of the American imperialism in conquering the Philippines were paid by the Filipino people themselves. They were forced to pay taxes to the colonial American government to support a large part of the expenses and interest of the bonds put in the name of the Filipino government through Wall Street banks. Of course, the enormous profits from the long exploitation of the Filipino people constituted the basic gain of the American imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Pentru a înțelege templierii, trebuie să înțelegem contextul care a dus la crearea ordinului. Perioada în care s-au desfășurat evenimentele este de obicei numită Evul Mediu Înalt, reprezentând epoca din istoria europeană care cuprinde secolele XI, XII și XIII (1000–1300 e.n.). Evul Mediu Înalt a fost precedat de Evul Mediu Timpuriu și urmat de Evul Mediu Târziu, care, prin convenție, se încheie în jurul anului 1500.
mt: To understand the Templars, we must understand the context that led to the creation of the order. The period in which the events took place is usually called the High Middle Ages, representing the era of European history that includes the eleventh, twelfth and thirteenth centuries (1000–1300 AD). The High Middle Ages was preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which, by convention, ends around the year 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Natura militaristă a Imperiului Roman a ajutat la dezvoltarea progreselor medicale. Împăratul Augustus a început să recruteze medici și chiar a format primul corp medical roman, care urma să intervină după lupte. Chirurgii cunoșteau diferite sedative, inclusiv morfina din extracte de semințe da mac și scopolamina din semințe de măselariță. Și-au îmbunătățit abilitățile de a efectua amputări pentru a salva pacienții de gangrenă, respectiv de a folosi turnichete și cleme arteriale pentru a opri sângerarea. De-a lungul mai multor secole, Imperiul Roman a facilitat descoperiri importante în domeniul medicinei și a pus bazele unei părți importante a cunoștințelor pe care le deținem astăzi.
mt: The militaristic nature of the Roman Empire helped to develop medical progress. Emperor Augustus began to recruit doctors and even formed the first Roman medical corps, which was to intervene after battles. Surgeons knew different sedatives, including morphine from poppy seed extracts and scopolamine from henbane seeds. They improved their abilities to perform amputations to save patients from gangrene, as well as using tourniquets and arterial clamps to stop bleeding. Over several centuries, the Roman Empire facilitated important discoveries in medicine and laid the foundations for an important part of the knowledge we have today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Vederea, sau abilitatea de a vedea, depinde de organele de simț ale aparatului vizual, sau ochi. Există multe arhitecturi diferite ale ochiului, care variază în complexitate în funcție de necesitățile organismului. Diferitele structuri au capacități diferite, sunt sensibile la lungimi de undă diferite și au grade de acuitate diferite; au de asemenea nevoie de procesare diferită pentru a transforma semnalul de intrare în informație coerentă și de numere diferite pentru o funcționare optimă.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on the sensory organs of the visual apparatus, or eyes. There are many different architectures of the eye, which vary in complexity according to the needs of the organism. The different structures have different sensitivities, are sensitive to different wavelengths, and have different degrees of acuity; they also have different processing needs to transform the input signal into coherent information and different numbers for optimal operation.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhismul este o religie din subcontinentul indian. A originat în regiunea Punjab în cursul secolului al XV-lea, în urma unei schisme sectare în interiorul tradiției hindu. Sikhii își văd religia ca fiind separată de hinduism, deși acceptă originea și tradițiile hinduse ale acesteia. „Numele pe care sikhii îl dau religiei lor este Gurmat, care în punjabi înseamnă «calea gurului». Gurul reprezintă un element esențial al tuturor religiilor indiene, dar în sikhism a câștigat o importanță deosebită, ajungând să formeze nucleul credințelor sikh.” Religia a fost fondată în secolul al XV-lea de către Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Acestuia a fost succedat de alți nouă guru.
mt: Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It originated in the Punjab region in the 15th century as a schism from Hinduism. Sikhs see their religion as separate from Hinduism, though they accept the Hindu origins and traditions of Sikhism. "The name which Sikhs give to their religion is Gurmat, which in Punjabi means 'the way of the guru.' The guru is an essential element of all Indian religions, but in Sikhism it has gained special importance, becoming the core of Sikh beliefs." The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). He was succeeded by nine other gurus.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: „Tulburarea de deficit de atenție «este un sindrom neurologic al cărui trio de simptome definitorii clasice includ impulsivitatea, neatenția și hiperactivitatea sau excesul de energie».” „Nu este o deficiență de învățare, ci o tulburare de învățare; «afectează între 3 și 5 la sută dintre copii, posibil până la 2 milioane de copii din America»”. Copiilor cu ADHD au dificultăți în a se concentra pe lucruri cum ar fi activitățile școlare, însă se pot concentra pe activități care le fac plăcere, de exemplu joaca, privirea desenelor animate preferate sau scrisul de propoziții fără semne de punctuație. „Acești copii tind să aibă o multitudine de probleme, pentru că «se angajează în comportamente riscante, intră în lupte și contestă autoritatea» în scopul de a-și stimula creierul, deoarece creierul lor nu poate fi stimulat prin metode obișnuite.” Deficitul de atenție afectează relațiile cu alte persoane deoarece alți copii nu pot înțelege de ce se comportă în acel fel sau de ce scriu în acel fel sau faptul că nivelul lor de maturizare este diferit.
mt: “ADHD is a neurologic syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms includes impulsivity, inattention, and hyperactivity or excess energy.” “It is not a learning disability, but a learning disorder; ‘affects between 3 and 5 percent of children, possibly up to 2 million children in America’.” Children with ADHD have difficulty focusing on things such as schoolwork, but can focus on activities they enjoy, such as playing, watching their favorite cartoons, or writing sentences without punctuation. “These children tend to have a multitude of problems, because ‘they engage in risky behaviors, get into fights and challenge authority’ in order to stimulate their brain, because their brain cannot be stimulated by normal methods.” ADHD affects relationships with other people because other children cannot understand why they behave that way or why they write that way or the fact that their level of maturity is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Deși învățarea bazată pe proiect ar trebui să ușureze și să facă mai interesantă învățarea, eșafodajul ajunge un pic mai departe. Metoda schelelor sau a șantierului nu este o metodă de învățare, ci mai degrabă un ajutor care oferă sprijin persoanelor care trec printr-o nouă experiență de învățare, cum ar fi utilizarea unui nou program de calculator sau începerea unui nou proiect. Schelele pot fi atât virtuale, cât și reale, cu alte cuvinte, un profesor este o formă de schelă, dar la fel este și micul om agrafă din Microsoft Office. Schele virtuale sunt incluse în software, având rolul de a interoga, oferi indicii și explica procedurile care altfel ar putea fi prea complicate pentru student să se ocupe de unul singur.
mt: While project-based learning should ease and make learning more interesting, the scaffolding goes a little further. The scaffolding or construction method is not a learning method, but rather a support that provides support to people who are going through a new learning experience, such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, that is, a teacher is a form of scaffolding, but so is the little man agraffa from Microsoft Office. Virtual scaffolds are included in software, having the role of interrogating, offering hints and explaining procedures that otherwise would be too complicated for the student to handle alone.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

mt: While project-based learning should ease and make learning more interesting, the scaffolding goes a little further. The scaffolding or construction method is not a learning method, but rather a support that provides support to people who are going through a new learning experience, such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, that is, a teacher is a form of scaffolding, but so is the little man agraffa from Microsoft Office. Virtual scaffolds are included in software, having the role of interrogating, offering hints and explaining procedures that otherwise would be too complicated for the student to handle alone.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace este al treilea website în ordinea popularității dintre cele utilizate în SUA și numără în acest moment 54 de milioane de utilizatori. Astfel de website-uri au avut parte de multă atenție, în mod deosebit în zona educației. Aceste website-uri au și aspecte pozitive care includ, printre altele, abilitatea de a organiza cu ușurință o pagină de curs care să includă bloguri, clipuri video, fotografii și alte elemente. Această pagină poate fi accesată cu ușurință folosind o singură adresă web, făcând-o ușor de ținut minte și simplu de scris pentru studenții care au dificultăți cu utilizarea unei tastaturi sau cu ortografia. Poate fi adaptat pentru a facilita citirea, având și cantitatea de culoare adaptată după dorință.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States and has 54 million users. Such websites have received much attention, especially in the education field. These websites have positive aspects, including the ability to easily organize a course page that includes blogs, video clips, photos, and other elements. This page can be accessed easily using a single web address, making it easy to remember and simple to write for students who have difficulty using a keyboard or spelling. It can be adapted to facilitate reading, with the amount of color adapted to taste.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Totuși, în iunie 1956, promisiunile lui Krushchev au fost puse la încercare, când revoltele din Polonia, unde muncitorii protestau împotriva crizelor alimentare și a micșorării salariilor, s-au transformat într-un protest general împotriva comunismului. Cu toate că, în cele din urmă, Hrușcev a trimis tancuri pentru a restaura ordinea, a cedat unor cereri de natură economică și a acceptat să-l numească ca prim ministru pe popularul Wladyslaw Gomulka.
mt: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test, when the Polish riots, where workers protested against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against communism. Although, in the end, Hrușcev sent tanks to restore order, he conceded to economic demands and accepted to name the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

Cu toate că, în cele din urmă, Hrușcev a trimis tancuri pentru a restaura ordinea, a cedat unor cereri de natură economică și a acceptat să-l numească ca prim ministru pe popularul Wladyslaw Gomulka.

Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Germania era un dușman comun în Al Doilea Război Mondial, ducând la o colaborare între URSS și SUA. Odată cu sfârșitul războiului, ciocnirile de sistem, proces și cultură au dus la distanțarea celor două țări. La doi ani de la sfârșitul războiului, foștii aliați erau acum dușmani și începea Războiul Rece. Urma să dureze patruzeci de ani și va fi luptat serios, de către armate „delegate”, pe câmpuri de luptă răspândite din Africa până-n Asia, în Afganistan, Cuba și multe alte locuri.
mt: Germany was a common enemy in World War II, leading to a collaboration between the USSR and the USA. With the end of the war, clashes of system, process and culture led to the estrangement of the two countries. Two years after the end of the war, former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It would last forty years and would be fought seriously, by proxy armies, on battlefields spread from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Sistemul nervos menține homeostazia trimițând impulsuri nervoase prin corp în scopul de a menține fluxul sangvin nu doar mișcare și constant. Aceste impulsuri nervoase pot fi transmise cu mare viteză în tot corpul, ceea ce ajută la menținerea siguranței corpului în cazul oricărei potențiale amenințări.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses throughout the body to maintain blood flow not only movement and constant. These nerve impulses can be transmitted at high speed throughout the body, which helps to maintain the safety of the body in the event of any potential threat.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Marea Piramidă din Giza este singura dintre cele șapte minuni ale lumii care a rămas în picioare până în zilele noastre. Construită de egipteni în secolul al III-lea î.e.n., Marea Piramidă este una dintre numeroasele structuri piramidale mari construite în cinstea unui faraon mort. „Platoul Giza, numit și «Necropola Giza», din Valea Morților, Egipt, adăpostește mai multe piramide (dintre care marea piramidă este cea mai înaltă), mai multe morminte mai mici, o serie de temple și marele Sfinx”. Marea Piramidă a fost construită pentru a-l onora pe faraonul Khufu, iar multe dintre piramidele mai mici, cavouri și temple au fost construite a-i onora pe soțiile și membrii familiei lui Khufu.
mt: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only one of the seven wonders of the world that has remained standing to this day. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BC, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built in honor of a deceased pharaoh. "The Giza Plateau, also known as the "Giza Necropolis", in the Valley of the Kings, Egypt, houses several pyramids (of which the Great Pyramid is the tallest), several smaller tombs, a series of temples and the Great Sphinx." The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Templul lui Artemis din Efes a fost distrus pe 21 iulie 356 î.e.n., într-un incendiu declanșat de Herostrat. Conform legendei, motivația lui a fost de a deveni faimos cu orice preț. Efesenii, indignați, au decretat ca numele lui Herostrat să nu fie menționat niciodată. Istoricul grec Strabon i-a consemnat ulterior numele, permițându-ne să-l cunoaștem în prezent. Templul a fost distrus în aceeași noapte în care s-a născut Alexandru cel Mare. În perioada în care era rege, Alexandru s-a oferit să plătească pentru reconstruirea templului, dar oferta sa a fost refuzată. Mai târziu, după moartea lui Alexandru, templul a fost reconstruit în anul 323 î.e.n.
mt: 21 July 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed in a fire started by Herostratus. According to legend, his motivation was to become famous at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, decreed that the name of Herostratus should never be mentioned. The Greek historian Strabo later recorded his name, allowing us to know him today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. During his reign, Alexander offered to pay for the reconstruction of the temple, but his offer was refused. Later, after the death of Alexander, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
