src: Primul mijloc de transport cunoscut a fost mersul pe jos; oamenii au început să meargă în poziție verticală acum 2 milioane de ani, odată cu apariția lui Homo Erectus (înseamnând omul drept). Predecesorul lor, Autralopithecus, nu mergea, de obicei, în poziție verticală. Se întâlnește specializare bipedă în fosile de Australopithecus vechi de 4,2-3,9 milioane de ani, deși e posibil ca Sahelanthropus să fi mers deja biped în urmă cu șapte milioane de ani.
mt: The first known means of transportation was walking on foot; humans began walking upright about two million years ago, with the appearance of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). His predecessor, Australopithecus, usually did not walk upright. Bipedal specialization is found in fossils of Australopithecus dating back 4.2-3.9 million years, although it is possible that Sahelanthropus was already bipedal seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Folosirea navelor pentru transportul de bunuri este de departe cel mai eficient mod de a transporta atât bunuri, cât și persoane dintr-o parte în alta a oceanelor. Tradițional, rolul marinei a fost să asigure capacitatea unei țări de a deplasa oameni și bunuri, interferând în același timp cu capacitatea inamicului de a transporta oameni și bunuri. Unul dintre exemplele recente mai notabile în acest sens a fost campania Nord Atlantică din Al Doilea Război Mondial. Americanii încercau să transporte oameni și materiale peste Oceanul Atlantic pentru a ajuta Marea Britanie. În același timp, marina germană, folosind îndeosebi submarine, încerca să oprească acest trafic. Dacă Aliații ar fi eșuat, Germania ar fi reușit probabil să ocupe Marea Britanie, cum a făcut-o cu restul Europei.
mt: The use of ships for the transport of goods is by far the most efficient way to transport both goods and people across oceans. Traditionally, the role of the navy has been to ensure a country's ability to move people and goods, while interfering with the enemy's ability to move people and goods. One of the more notable recent examples in this regard was the North Atlantic campaign of World War II. The Americans were trying to transport people and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using primarily submarines, was trying to stop this traffic. If the Allies had failed, Germany would have probably succeeded in occupying Britain, as it did with the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Inventarea roților cu spițe a făcut carele asiriene mai ușoare, mai rapide și mai bine pregătite pentru a depăși soldații și alte care de luptă. Săgețile arcurilor lor letale puteau penetra armura soldaților dușmani. În jurul anului 1000 î.e.n., asirienii au fost primii care au utilizat cavaleria. Cavaleria este armata care luptă călare. Șaua nu fusese inventată încă, așa că asirienii luptau călare direct pe spinarea cailor.
mt: The invention of the spoked wheel made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster and better prepared to outmaneuver enemy soldiers and other chariots. Their deadly arrows could penetrate enemy soldiers' armor. Around 1000 B.C., Assyrians were the first to use cavalry. Cavalry is the army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so Assyrians fought on horseback directly on the horse's back.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Babilonienii construiau un templu principal pentru fiecare dintre zeii lor, care era considerat ca fiind casa acelui zeu. Oamenii aduceau jertfe zeilor, iar preoții încercau să răspundă nevoilor zeilor prin ceremonii și festivaluri. Fiecare templu avea o curte a templului deschisă și un sanctuar intern în care puteau intra doar preoții. Uneori, ca parte a templelor, se construiau și turnuri în formă de piramidă numite zigurate. Vârful turnului constituia sanctuarul dedicat zeului.
mt: Babylonians built a main temple for each of their gods, which was considered the home of that god. People brought sacrifices to the gods, and priests tried to meet the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard of the temple and an inner sanctuary where only priests could enter. Sometimes, as part of the temples, pyramidal towers called ziggurats were also built. The top of the tower constituted the sanctuary dedicated to the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: „Da! Regele Tutankhamon, numit uneori și «Regele Tut» sau «Regele băiat», este unul dintre regii Egiptului antic cel mai bine cunoscut în zilele noastre.” Aspect interesant, el nu a fost considerat a fi foarte important în vechime și nu a fost înregistrat pe cele mai multe dintre listele regilor antici. Cu toate acestea, descoperirea mormântului său în 1922 l-a făcut celebru. În timp ce multe morminte din trecut au fost jefuite, acest mormânt a rămas practic neatins. Cele mai multe dintre obiectele îngropate alături de Tutankhamon s-au păstrat bine, inclusiv mii de artefacte făcute din metale prețioase și pietre rare.
mt: “Yes! King Tutankhamon, sometimes called “King Tut” or “Boy King”, is one of the best-known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times.” An interesting fact, he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not listed on many of the ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him famous. While many tombs from the past have been looted, this tomb remained largely untouched. Most of the objects buried alongside Tutankhamon have been well-preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and rare stones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: „Da! Regele Tutankhamon, numit uneori și «Regele Tut» sau «Regele băiat», este unul dintre regii Egiptului antic cel mai bine cunoscut în zilele noastre.” Aspect interesant, el nu a fost considerat a fi foarte important în vechime și nu a fost înregistrat pe cele mai multe dintre listele regilor antici. Cu toate acestea, descoperirea mormântului său în 1922 l-a făcut celebru. În timp ce multe morminte din trecut au fost jefuite, acest mormânt a rămas practic neatins. Cele mai multe dintre obiectele îngropate alături de Tutankhamon s-au păstrat bine, inclusiv mii de artefacte făcute din metale prețioase și pietre rare.

However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him famous. While many tombs from the past have been looted, this tomb remained largely untouched. Most of the objects buried alongside Tutankhamon have been well-preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and rare stones.

Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. src: Noi cunoaștem mulți politicieni, oameni de știință și artiști greci. Probabil cea mai cunoscută persoană a acestei culturi este Homer, legendarul poet orb, care a compus 2 capodopere ale literaturii grecești: poemele Iliada și Odiseea. Sofocle și Aristofan sunt în continuare dramaturgi apreciați și piesele lor sunt considerate a fi printre cele mai mari opere ale literaturii mondiale. Un alt grec celebru este matematicianul Pitagora, cunoscut mai ales pentru faimoasa lui teoremă despre raporturile dintre laturile triunghiului dreptunghic.
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists. Probably the most famous person of this culture is Homer, the blind legendary poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the Iliad and the Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still appreciated dramatists and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is mathematician Pythagoras, known mainly for his famous theorem about the ratios of the sides of the right triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: În climatul cald din Orientul Mijlociu, casa era mai puțin importantă. Cea mai mare parte a vieții unei familii evreiești se desfășura în aer liber. Femeile găteau în curte; magazinele erau doar tejghele care dădeau drept în stradă. La construcția caselor se folosea piatră. În țara Canaanului nu erau păduri mari, astfel încât lemnul era foarte scump.
mt: In the hot climate of the Middle East, the house was less important. Most of the life of a Jewish family took place outdoors. Women cooked in the courtyard; shops were just counters that opened directly onto the street. Houses were built of stone. In the land of Canaan there were not large forests, so wood was very expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: Groenlanda a fost puțin colonizată. În saga scandinavă se spune că Erik cel Roșu a fost exilat din Islanda pentru crimă și în timp ce călătorea mai înspre vest, a găsit Pământ Verde și l-a numit Groenlanda. Însă, indiferent de descoperirile pe care le-a făcut, triburi de eschimoși trăiau deja în acele locuri pe vremea aceea. Cu toate că erau toate țări „scandinave”, existau multe diferențe în ceea ce privește populația, regii, obiceiurile și istoria Danemarcei, Suediei, Norvegiei și Islandei.
mt: Groenlanda was little colonized. In the Scandinavian saga it is said that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for crime and while traveling further west, he found Land Green and named it Greenland. However, regardless of the discoveries he made, Eskimo tribes already lived in those places at that time. Despite being all "Scandinavian" countries, there were many differences in terms of population, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: În timp ce marea parte a bucătăriei lor ne-ar fi familiară, romanii aveau și feluri de mâncare festive ciudate sau neobișnuite, care includeau mistreți, păuni, melci și o rozătoare numită pârș. O altă diferență consta în faptul că, în timp ce oamenii săraci și femeile mâncau stând pe scaun, bărbaților bogați le plăcea să facă banchete în care stăteau întinși pe o parte în timp ce mâncau. Bucătăria Romei antice nu putea să includă mâncăruri care au sosit în Europa, din America sau din Asia, în secolele ulterioare. De exemplu, nu aveau porumb, nici roșii, nici cartofi, nici cacao și niciun roman antic nu a gustat vreodată un curcan.
mt: While most of their kitchen would be familiar to us, the Romans had strange or unusual festive dishes that included boars, peacocks, snails and a rodent called the porcupine. Another difference was that while the poor and women ate sitting on chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets where they lay on their side while eating. The kitchen of ancient Rome could not include dishes that came to Europe from America or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, chocolate and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: O civilizație este o cultură unică împărtășită de un grup de oameni semnificativ de mare care trăiesc și muncesc cooperativ, o societate. Cuvântul civilizație provine din latinescul civilis, adică civil, fiind înrudit cu latinul civis, adică cetățean, și cu civitas, adică oraș sau oraș-stat; de asemenea, acesta definește într-un fel și mărimea societății. Orașele stat sunt precursoarele națiunilor. O cultură civilizatoare implică transmiterea de cunoștințe de-a lungul mai multor generații, o amprentă culturală persistentă și o răspândire rezonabilă. Culturile minore dispar adesea fără a lăsa dovezi istorice relevante și nu sunt recunoscute ca civilizații propriu-zise.
mt: A civilization is a unique culture shared by a significant number of people living and working cooperatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state; it also defines the size of the society. City-states are precursors of nations. A civilizing culture involves the transmission of knowledge across generations, a persistent cultural imprint, and a reasonable spread. Minor cultures often disappear without leaving relevant historical evidence and are not recognized as civilizations proper.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong este o fortăreață în ruine și o mânăstire budistă, situată în partea superioară a Districtului Paro (în satul Phondey). Se spune că Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel ar fi construit fortăreața în 1649 pentru a-și comemora victoria împotriva forțelor tibetano-mongole. În 1951, un incendiu a făcut ca doar unele dintre relicvele de la Drukgyal Dzong să mai existe, cum ar fi efigia lui Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. După incendiu, fortăreața a fost conservată și protejată, rămânând una dintre atracțiile cele mai senzaționale ale Bhutanului.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery, located in the upper part of Paro District (in Phondey village). It is said that Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal built the fortress in 1649 to commemorate his victory over Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire destroyed most of the relics at Drukgyal Dzong, leaving only some of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal's statues. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining one of Bhutan's most spectacular attractions.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: În secolul al XVIII-lea, Cambodgia s-a aflat între doi vecini puternici, Thailanda și Vietnam. Thailizii au invadat Cambodgia de mai multe ori în secolul al XVIII-lea, iar în 1772 au distrus Phnom Phen. În ultimii ani ai secolului al XVIII-lea, vietnamezii au invadat și Cambodgia.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia was between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century, and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, the Vietnamese invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Începutul Taiwanului a avut loc cu mult timp în urmă, în secolul al XV-lea, când marinarii europeni care treceau pe lângă insulă, au consemnat numele ca fiind Ilha Formosa sau insula frumoasă. În 1624, Compania Indiilor Olandeze de Est își stabilește o bază în sud-vestul Taiwanului, începând o transformare în practicile de producție a cerealelor aborigene și angajând lucrători chinezi pentru a lucra pe plantațiile de zahăr și orez. În 1683, forțele dinastiei Qing (1644 - 1912) preiau controlul asupra zonelor costale vestice și nordice ale Taiwanului și declară Taiwanul provincie a Imperiului Qing, în 1885. În 1985, după înfrângerea din primul război sino-japonez (1984-1895), guvernul Qing semnează Tratatul de la Shimonoseki, prin care cedează suveranitatea asupra Taiwanului către Japonia, care guvernează insula până în 1945.
mt: Taiwan began much earlier, in the 15th century, when European sailors passing by the island recorded its name as Ilha Formosa or the beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, beginning a transformation of the aboriginal cereal production practices and hiring Chinese workers to work on the sugar and rice plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty forces took control of the island's western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire, in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the first Sino-Japanese war (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, ceding sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which governed the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Aceasta este numite pH-ul unei substanțe chimice. Se poate prepara un indicator folosind suc de varză roșie. Sucul de varză își schimbă culoarea în funcție de cât de acidă sau de bazică (alcalină) este substanța chimică. Nivelul pH-ului este indicat de cantitatea de ioni de hidrogen (H în pH) din substanța chimică testată. Ionii de hidrogen sunt protoni cărora le-au fost înlăturaţi electronii (dat fiind că atomii de hidrogen constau dintr-un proton și un electron).
mt: This is called the pH of a chemical substance. A pH indicator can be prepared using red cabbage juice. The juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical substance is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the chemical substance being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons that have had electrons removed from them (since hydrogen atoms consist of a proton and an electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Aceasta este numite pH-ul unei substanțe chimice. Se poate prepara un indicator folosind suc de varză roșie. Sucul de varză își schimbă culoarea în funcție de cât de acidă sau de bazică (alcalină) este substanța chimică. Nivelul pH-ului este indicat de cantitatea de ioni de hidrogen (H în pH) din substanța chimică testată. Ionii de hidrogen sunt protoni cărora le-au fost înlăturaţi electronii (dat fiind că atomii de hidrogen constau dintr-un proton și un electron).
mt: This is called the pH of a chemical substance. A pH indicator can be prepared using red cabbage juice. The juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical substance is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the chemical substance being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons that have had electrons removed from them (since hydrogen atoms consist of a proton and an electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Leii sunt felinele cele mai sociale, trăind în grupuri mari numite haite. Familiile sunt formate din unu până la trei masculi adulți înrudiți, alături de până la treizeci de femele și pui. Femelele sunt de obicei înrudite între ele, fiind o familie numeroasă de surori și fiice. Familiile de lei se comportă foarte asemănător cu haitele de lupi sau câini, animale cu comportament surprinzător de similar leilor (dar nu și altor feline mari), și de asemenea foarte letale pentru prada lor.
mt: Lions are the most social of the cats, living in large groups called prides. Families are formed of one to three adult males related to each other, along with up to thirty females and cubs. Females are usually related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion families behave very similarly to wolf or dog packs, animals with surprising behavior similar to lions (but not to other large cats), and also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Dedesubtul lor avem mai multe feline de dimensiuni medii, care se hrănesc cu pradă de dimensiuni medii, de la iepuri la antilope și căprioare. În cele din urmă, există multe feline mici (inclusiv pisici de companie libere) care mănâncă mult mai numeroasele prăzi mici, cum ar fi insecte, rozătoare, șopârle și păsări. Cheia succesului lor este conceptul de nișă; fiecare felină are propriul rol de îndeplinit, astfel încât nu este în concurență cu altele.
mt: Below them are several medium-sized cats, which feed on medium-sized prey, from rabbits to antelopes and deer. In the end, there are many small cats (including free-roaming house cats) that eat much more numerous small prey, such as insects, rodents, lizards and birds. The key to their success is the concept of niche; each cat has its own role to fulfill, so they are not in competition with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Oceloților le place să consume animale mici. Dacă pot, vor prinde maimuțe, șerpi, rozătoare sau păsări. Aproape toate animalele pe care le vânează ocelotul sunt mult mai mici decât acesta. Oamenii de știință sunt de părere că oceloții urmăresc și găsesc animale de mâncat (pradă) cu ajutorul mirosului, adulmecând terenul pentru a le găsi. Grație vederii nocturne, pot vedea foarte bine pe întuneric și se pot deplasa nedetectați. Oceloții își vânează prada camuflându-se în mediul în care se află, apoi aruncându-se asupra prăzii.
mt: Ocelots like to eat small animals. If they can, they will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents or birds. Almost all animals that ocelots hunt are smaller than them. Scientists believe that ocelots track and find their prey (game) with the help of smell, sniffing the ground to find them. Thanks to their nocturnal vision, they can see very well in the dark and move undetected. Ocelots hunt their prey by camouflaging themselves in the environment they are in, then pouncing on the prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Atlet complet, tigrul se poate cățăra (deși nu bine), înota, poate face salturi pe distanțe mari și poate trage cu o forță de cinci ori mai mare decât cea a unui om puternic. Tigrii se încadrează în același grup (genul Panthera) cu leii, leoparzii și jaguarii. Aceste patru feline sunt singurele care pot rage. Răgetul tigrului nu seamănă cu răgetul cu voce plină al unui leu, ci mai degrabă cu o propoziție de cuvinte ascuțite, strigate.
mt: 100% complete, the tiger can climb (although not well), swim, jump long distances and pull with a force five times greater than that of a strong man. Tigers are in the same group (genus Panthera) with lions, leopards and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones that can roar. The tiger's roar does not sound like the roar of a full voice lion, but rather like a sentence of sharp words, shouted.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Celula este cea mai mică unitate structurală și funcțională a unui organism viu. Celulă provine din cuvântul latin cella, care înseamnă cameră mică. Dacă observi ființele vii sub un microscop, vei vedea că toate sunt alcătuite din mici pătrățele sau cercuri. Robert Hooke, un biolog din Anglia, a observat pătrățele micuțe în plută cu ajutorul unui microscop. Arătau ca niște camere. El a fost prima persoană care a observat celulele moarte.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism. The word cell comes from the Latin cella meaning small room. If you observe living things under a microscope, you will see that they are all made up of small squares or circles. Robert Hooke, a biologist in England, observed tiny squares in wood using a microscope. They looked like small rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Animalele sunt alcătuite din multe celule. Ele mănâncă și digeră în interiorul corpului. Majoritatea animalelor se pot deplasa. Numai animalele au creier (deși nici măcar toate animalele nu au; meduzele, de exemplu, nu au creier). Există animale peste tot în lume. Acestea sapă în pământ, înoată în oceane și zboară pe cer.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat and digest inside their bodies. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (although not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, don't have brains). There are animals everywhere in the world. They burrow in the ground, swim in oceans and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Plantele produc oxigen, pe care oamenii îl respiră, și absorb dioxid de carbon, pe care oamenii îl expiră (adică îl dau afară din plămâni). Plantele își produc hrana cu ajutorul soarelui, prin fotosinteză. În plus, fac umbră. Ne facem casele din plante și facem haine din plante. Majoritatea alimentelor pe care le mâncăm sunt plante. Fără plante, animalele nu ar putea supraviețui.
mt: Plants produce oxygen, which people breathe, and absorb carbon dioxide, which people exhale (that is, they give out of their lungs). Plants produce their food with the help of the sun, through photosynthesis. In addition, they provide shade. We build our houses out of plants and make clothes out of plants. Most of the food we eat is plants. Without plants, animals would not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Când un grup mic de viețuitoare (o populație mică) ajunge să fie izolat de populația principală din care provine (de exemplu, dacă se deplasează peste un lanț muntos sau un râu ori dacă se mută pe o insulă nouă, de unde nu se poate întoarce înapoi cu ușurință), se va găsi adesea într-un mediu diferit de cel în care au fost înainte. Acest nou mediu are resurse diferite și concurenți diferiți, astfel încât noua populație va avea nevoie de caracteristici sau adaptări diferite pentru a fi un concurent mai puternic decât ceea ce aveau nevoie înainte. Populația inițială nu s-a schimbat deloc, are nevoie de aceleași adaptări ca și înainte. Odată cu trecerea timpului, pe măsură ce noua populație se adaptează mediului, membrii acesteia încep să arate din ce în ce mai puțin similar celeilalte populații. În cele din urmă, după mii sau chiar milioane de ani, cele două populații vor arăta atât de diferit una de alta încât nu vom mai putea spune că sunt aceeași specie. Acest proces poartă denumirea de speciație,ceea ce înseamnă formarea de specii noi. Speciația este o consecință ce nu poate fi evitată și reprezintă o parte foarte importantă a evoluției.
mt: When a small population (a small population) becomes isolated from the main population from which it came (for example, if it moves over a mountain range or a river or if it moves to a new island from which it cannot easily return), it will often find itself in a different environment from the one it was in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different characteristics or adaptations to be a stronger competitor than it did before. The original population has not changed at all, it needs the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population adapts to the environment, its members begin to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different from each other that we will no longer be able to say that they are the same species. This process is called speciation, which means the formation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and is an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Organul major al sistemului circulator este inima, care pompează sângele. Sângele pleacă dinspre inimă în vase numite artere și se întoarce la inimă în vase numite vene. Cele mai mici vase sunt numite capilare.
mt: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart in vessels called arteries and returns to the heart in vessels called veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Organul major al sistemului circulator este inima, care pompează sângele. Sângele pleacă dinspre inimă în vase numite artere și se întoarce la inimă în vase numite vene. Cele mai mici vase sunt numite capilare.
mt: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart in vessels called arteries and returns to the heart in vessels called veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Insectele au fost primele animale care au început să zboare. Abilitatea de a zbura le-a permis să evite cu mai multă ușurință inamicii și să găsească mâncare și parteneri pentru împerechere mult mai eficient. Cele mai multe insecte au avantajul de putea să-și plieze aripile în spate de-a lungul corpului. Asta le oferă o gamă mai largă de locuri mici pentru a se ascunde de prădători. În zilele noastre, singurele insecte care nu-și pot plia aripile sunt libelulele și efemeridele.
mt: Insects were the first animals to begin flying. The ability to fly allowed them to avoid enemies and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings along their body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold their wings are dragonflies and mayflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

Cele mai multe insecte au avantajul de putea să-și plieze aripile în spate de-a lungul corpului. Asta le oferă o gamă mai largă de locuri mici pentru a se ascunde de prădători. În zilele noastre, singurele insecte care nu-și pot plia aripile sunt libelulele și efemeridele.
mt: Insects were the first animals to begin flying. The ability to fly allowed them to avoid enemies and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings along their body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold their wings are dragonflies and mayflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Mulți paleontologi, astăzi, cred că un grup de dinozauri a supraviețuit și este în viață în ziua de azi. Noi îi numim păsări. Multi oameni nu se gândesc la ele ca fiind dinozauri, deoarece au pene și pot zbura. Dar la păsări se pot încă vedea multe caracteristici similare dinozaurilor. Au picioare cu solzi și gheare, depun ouă și merg pe cele două picioare din spate ca un T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists today believe that a group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But birds still have many similar characteristics to dinosaurs. They have scales and claws on their feet, lay eggs, and walk on their hind legs like a T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Dinții unui triceratops ar fi fost capabili de a măcina nu numai frunze, ci și rădăcini și ramuri foarte tari. Unii oameni de știință sunt de părere că triceratopsul se hrănea cu plante din clasa cycadofitelor, un tip de plante des întâlnit în cretacic. Aceste plante arată ca niște mici palmieri cu coroane compuse din frunze ascuțite și țepoase. Un triceratops și-ar fi putut folosi ciocul puternic pentru a îndepărta frunzele înainte de a mânca trunchiul. Alți oameni de știință susțin că aceste plante sunt extrem de toxice și, prin urmare, e improbabil ca vreun dinozaur să le fi consumat, cu toate că în zilele noastre leneșul și alte animale precum papagalul (un descendent al dinozaurilor) pot mânca frunze și fructe otrăvitoare.
mt: The teeth of a triceratops would have been able to chew not only leaves, but also roots and very tough branches. Some scientists believe the triceratops ate cycadofite plants, a type of plant commonly found in the cretaceous. These plants look like small palm trees with crowns composed of sharp and thorny leaves. A triceratops would have used its strong beak to remove leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are extremely toxic and, therefore, it is unlikely that any dinosaur would have consumed them, although in our days the sloth and other animals such as the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves and fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Fotbalul național al Italiei, împreună cu echipa națională germană de fotbal se află pe locul doi în topul celor mai de succes echipe din lume și au fost campionii Cupei Mondiale de Fotbal FIFA, în 2006. Printre sporturile populare se numără fotbalul, baschetul, voleiul, polo în apă, scrima, rugbiul, ciclismul, hocheiul pe gheață, hocheiul pe role și cursele de F1. Sporturile de iarnă sunt cele mai populare în regiunile nordice, italienii luând parte la concursuri internaționale și evenimente olimpice.
mt: Italy's national football team, along with Germany's national football team, is second in the list of the most successful teams in the world and were the FIFA World Cup Football Champions in 2006. Among the popular sports are football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and Formula 1. Winter sports are the most popular in the northern regions, Italians taking part in international competitions and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxemburg are o istorie lungă, dar independența sa datează din 1839. Unele zone ale Belgiei din zilele noastre făceau parte din Luxemburg în trecut, dar au devenit belgiene după Revoluția belgiană din anii 1830. Luxemburg a încercat întotdeauna să rămână o țară neutră, dar a fost ocupat de Germania atât în Primul Război Mondial, cât și în Al Doilea Război Mondial. În 1957, Luxemburg a devenit membru fondator al organizației cunoscute azi ca Uniunea Europeană.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but its independence dates back to 1839. Some areas of Belgium today were part of Luxembourg in the past, but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution in the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but was occupied by Germany both in World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization known today as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Turcia europeană (Tracia Răsăriteană sau Rumelia, în Peninsula Balcanică) reprezintă 3% din teritoriul țării. Teritoriul Turciei are o lungime de peste 1600 de kilometri (1000 de mile) și o lățime de 800 km (500 de mile), cu o formă aproximativ dreptunghiulară. Suprafața Turciei, incluzând lacurile, este de 783.562 kilometri pătrați (300.948 mile pătrate), din care 755.688 kilometri pătrați (291.773 mile pătrate) în Asia de Sud-Vest și 23.764 kilometri pătrați (9.174 mile pătrate) în Europa. Suprafața ocupată de Turcia o face a 37-a țară din lume ca mărime, fiind aproximativ cât Franța metropolitană și Marea Britanie puse la un loc. Turcia este înconjurată de mări pe trei părți: Marea Egee la vest, Marea Neagră la nord și Marea Mediterană la sud.
mt: 3% of the country is European (Thrace or Rumelia, in the Balkan Peninsula). The territory of Turkey has a length of over 1600 kilometers (1000 miles) and a width of 800 km (500 miles), with an approximately rectangular shape. The area of Turkey, including lakes, is 783,562 square kilometers (300,948 square miles), of which 755,688 square kilometers (291,773 square miles) in Southwest Asia and 23,764 square kilometers (9,174 square miles) in Europe. The area occupied by Turkey makes it the 37th largest country in the world, approximately the size of metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is surrounded by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Populația Cetății Vaticanului este în jur de 800 de persoane. Este cea mai mică țară independentă din lume și țara cu cea mai mică populație. Cetatea Vaticanului folosește limba italiană în legislația sa și în comunicările oficiale. Italiana este, de asemenea, limba folosită zi de zi de majoritatea celor care lucrează în țară, în timp ce latina este adesea folosită în ceremoniile religioase. Toți locuitorii Vaticanului sunt romano-catolici.
mt: The population of the Vatican City is about 800 people. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the smallest population. The Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and in official communications. Italian is also the language used daily by most people who work in the country, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All residents of the Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: În ziua de astăzi, calculatoarele sunt folosite pentru a manipula imagini și secvențe video. Animații sofisticate pot fi create pe calculator, iar acest tip de animație este folosit tot mai des în televiziune și în filme. Muzica este adesea înregistrată folosind computere sofisticate pentru a procesa și combina sunetele.
mt: Today, computers are used to manipulate images and video sequences. Sophisticated animations can be created on a computer, and this type of animation is used more and more in television and in movies. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and combine sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Orașele Harappa și Mohenjo-daro aveau toalete în aproape fiecare casă, atașate unui sistem de canalizare sofisticat. Resturi din sistemele de canalizare au fost găsite în casele din orașele minoane din Creta și Santorini, în Grecia. Se găseau toalete și în Egiptul antic, Persia și China. La romani, toaletele se găseau uneori ca parte a băilor publice, pe care bărbații și femeile le foloseau în comun.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had toilets in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewer system. Remains of sewer systems have been found in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini, in Greece. Toilets were also found in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Rome, toilets were sometimes part of public baths, which men and women used in common.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Lama unei patine de gheață moderne are două muchii cu o regiune concavă între ele. Cele 2 muchii permit un contact mai bun cu gheața, chiar când acestea sunt înclinate. Din cauză că partea inferioară a lamei este ușor curbată, pe măsură ce lama se înclină într-o parte sau în cealaltă se curbează și muchia care se află în contact cu gheața. Acest lucru face ca patinatorul să întoarcă. Dacă patinele se înclină spre dreapta, patinatorul o ia spre dreapta, dacă patinele se înclină spre stânga, patinatorul o ia spre stânga.
mt: 2 blades of modern ice skates have two edges with a concave region between them. The 2 edges allow a better contact with ice, even when they are tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to the right or to the left, the edge that is in contact with the ice curves too. This makes the skater turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater goes to the right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater goes to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Pentru a reveni la nivelul anterior de energie, trebuie să elimine energia suplimentară pe care a primit-o de la lumină. „Fac asta emițând o minusculă particulă de lumină numită «foton».” „Oamenii de știință numesc acest proces «emisie stimulată de radiații», deoarece atomii sunt stimulați de către lumina puternică, ducând la emiterea unui foton de lumină, iar lumina este un tip de radiație.” Imaginea următoare prezintă atomii emițând fotoni. Bineînțeles, în realitate fotonii sunt mult mai mici decât cei din imagine. Fotonii sunt chiar mai mici decât lucrurile care alcătuiesc atomii!
mt: To return to the previous energy level, you must eliminate the extra energy you received from light. "I do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a 'photon.'" "Scientists call this process'stimulated emission of radiation,' because atoms are stimulated by the bright light, leading to the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation." The following image shows atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality, photons are much smaller than the things that make up atoms!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

Bineînțeles, în realitate fotonii sunt mult mai mici decât cei din imagine. Fotonii sunt chiar mai mici decât lucrurile care alcătuiesc atomii!
mt: To return to the previous energy level, you must eliminate the extra energy you received from light. "I do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a 'photon.'" "Scientists call this process'stimulated emission of radiation,' because atoms are stimulated by the bright light, leading to the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation." The following image shows atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality, photons are much smaller than the things that make up atoms!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: După sute de ore de funcționare, filamentul becului se arde până la urmă, iar becul nu mai funcționează. Apoi este nevoie să schimbați becul. Schimbarea becului trebuie să fie făcută cu atenție. În primul rând, comutatorul pentru corpul de iluminat trebuie sa fie oprit sau cablul deconectat. Aceasta se datorează faptului că electricitatea din dulie, unde se inserează partea metalică a becului, vă poate electrocuta grav dacă atingeți interiorul duliei sau baza metalică a becului când acesta e încă în parte în interiorul duliei.
mt: After hundreds of hours of operation, the filament of the bulb burns out eventually, and the bulb no longer works. Then you need to change the bulb. Changing the bulb must be done carefully. First, the switch for the light fixture must be turned off or the power disconnected. This is due to the fact that electricity in the socket, where the metal part of the bulb is inserted, can severely electrocute you if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb when it is still partially in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bomba de fisiune funcționează conform principiului că este nevoie de energie pentru a asambla un nucleu cu mulți protoni și neutroni. Similar cu împingerea unei căruțe grele la deal. Spargerea din nou a nucleului eliberează o parte din acea energie. Unii atomi au nuclee instabile, ceea ce înseamnă că tind să se descompună cu un impuls mic sau fără impuls.
mt: Fission works on the principle that it takes energy to assemble a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Similar to pushing a heavy cart up a hill. Breaking the nucleus releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei, meaning they tend to decompose with a small impulse or without impulse.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Când apelezi pe cineva aflat la mii de kilometri distanță, faci asta printr-un satelit. Satelitul din spațiu primește apelul și apoi îl reflectă înapoi, aproape instantaneu. Satelitul a fost trimis în spațiu cu o rachetă. Oamenii de știință folosesc telescoape în spațiu, deoarece atmosfera Pământului ne distorsionează o parte din lumină și vedere. Este nevoie de o rachetă uriașă, înaltă de 100 de picioare, pentru duce în spațiu un satelit sau un telescop.
mt: When you call someone thousands of miles away, you do it through a satellite. The satellite in space receives the call and then reflects it back, almost instantaneously. The satellite was sent into space with a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space, because Earth's atmosphere distorts some of our light and vision. It takes a huge rocket, 100 feet tall, to carry a satellite or a telescope into space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Timpul este ceva aflat pretutindeni în jurul nostru și care afectează tot ce facem, dar, cu toate acestea, este dificil de înțeles. Timpul a fost studiat de mii de ani de către teologi, filozofi și oameni de știință. Percepem timpul ca pe o serie de evenimente care trec din viitor, prin prezent, în trecut. Timpul este și ceea ce folosim pentru a compara durata (lungimea) evenimentelor. Oricine poate măsura trecerea timpului prin observarea repetării unui eveniment ciclic. Un eveniment ciclic este unul care are loc iar și iar, în mod regulat.
mt: Time is something that is all around us and that affects everything we do, but, nevertheless, it is difficult to understand. Time has been studied for thousands of years by theologians, philosophers and scientists. We perceive time as a series of events that pass from future, through present, to past. Time is also what we use to compare durations (lengths) of events. Anyone can measure the passage of time by observing the repetition of a cyclic event. A cyclic event is one that happens again and again, in a regular manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Conform tradiției, moștenitorul tronului urma să se înroleze în armată imediat după terminarea școlii. Cu toate acestea, Charles a mers la facultate la Colegiul Trinity, Cambridge, unde a studiat Antropologia și Arheologia, iar mai târziu Istoria, obținând un 2:2 (o diplomă inferioară, de clasa a doua). Charles a fost primul membru al familiei regale britanice care a obținut o diplomă universitară.
mt: According to tradition, the heir to the throne was to enlist in the army immediately after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge, where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, obtaining a 2:2 (a lower degree, of the second class). Charles was the first member of the British royal family to obtain a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Anglia a avut parte de o lungă perioadă de pace după recucerirea teritoriului Danelaw. Totuși, în 991 Ethelred s-a confruntat cu o flotă Viking mai mare decât oricare alta din ultimul secol, după cea a lui Guthrum. Această flotă era condusă de Olaf Trygvasson, un norvegian cu ambiții de eliberare a țării sale de sub dominația daneză. După insuccese militare inițiale, Ethelred a reușit să cadă de acord cu Olaf, care s-a întors în Norvegia pentru a încerca, cu mai mult sau mai puțin succes, să-și recâștige regatul.
mt: 991 AD: England had enjoyed a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However, in 991 Ethelred faced a Viking fleet larger than any in the last century, after that of Guthrum. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to liberate his country from Danish domination. After initial military failures, Ethelred managed to come to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try, with varying success, to regain his kingdom.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: În jurul secolului al XV-lea, nordul Estoniei a fost puternic influențat cultural de Germania. Niște călugări germani au dorit să Îl aducă pe Dumnezeu mai aproape de băștinași, așa că au inventat limba literală estoniană. „Avea la bază alfabetul german, căruia i-a fost adăugată o literă, «Õ/õ».” Cu timpul, multe cuvinte împrumutate din germană s-au contopit în limbă. Acesta a fost începutul iluminării.
mt: 15th century Estonia was heavily influenced by Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the locals, so they invented the literal Estonian language. “It was based on the German alphabet, to which the letter «Õ/õ» was added.” Over time, many German loanwords were assimilated into the language. This was the beginning of the enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Există diferite estimări cu privire la numărul vorbitorilor de hindi. Se estimează că ar fi de la a doua la a patra cea mai vorbită limbă din lume. Numărul de vorbitori nativi variază și depinde dacă se numără sau nu dialectele foarte strâns legate între ele. Estimările variază între 340 de milioane și 500 de milioane de vorbitori și până la 800 de milioane de persoane care pot înțelege limba. Limbile hindi și urdu au vocabulare similare, dar diferă privind scriere; de obicei, în conversațiile de zi cu zi, vorbitorii acestor limbi se pot înțelege reciproc.
mt: There are different estimates about the number of Hindi speakers. It is estimated to be the second or third most spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies and depends on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates vary between 340 million and 500 million speakers and up to 800 million people who can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu have similar vocabularies, but differ in writing; usually, in everyday conversations, speakers of these languages can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangul este singurul alfabet inventat cu scop precis, utilizat în mod curent. Alfabetul a fost inventat în 1444, în timpul domniei regelui Sejong (1418 – 1450). Regele Sejong a fost al patrulea rege al dinastiei Joseon și este unul dintre cei mai respectați. „Inițial, a numit alfabetul Hangeul, Hunmin Jeongeum, care înseamnă «sunetele corecte pentru instruirea oamenilor».”
mt: Hangul is the only alphabet invented with a specific purpose, and is currently in use. The alphabet was invented in 1444, during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty and is one of the most respected. “Initially, he named the alphabet Hangeul, Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ‘correct sounds for the education of people.’”
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Există multe teorii cu privire la originile sanscritei. Una dintre ele privește o migrație a arienilor din vest spre India, aceștia aducându-și limba cu ei. Sanscrita este o limbă veche și este comparabilă cu limba latină vorbită în Europa. Cea mai veche carte cunoscută din întreaga lume a fost scrisă în sanscrită. După culegerea Upanișadelor, sanscrita a trecut în uitare din cauza ierarhiei. Sanscrita este o limbă foarte complexă și bogată, care a s-a dovedit a fi sursa multor limbi indiene moderne, la fel cum latina este sursa pentru limbile europene, precum franceza și spaniola.
mt: There are many theories about the origins of Sanskrit. One of them involves a migration of the Aryans from the west to India, bringing their language with them. Sanskrit is an old language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The oldest known book in the entire world was written in Sanskrit. After the collection of the Upanishads, Sanskrit passed into obscurity due to its hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language that has proven to be the source of many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source for European languages, such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Cum m-ar afecta forța de gravitație pe Io? Dacă ați sta pe suprafața lui Io, ați cântări mai puțin decât cântăriți pe Pământ. O persoană care cântărește 200 de livre (90 kg) pe Pământ ar cântări circa 36 de livre (16 kg) pe Io. Așadar forța de gravitație, bineînțeles, te trage mai puțin în jos.
mt: How would gravity affect me on Io? If you were standing on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on Io. So, of course, gravity pulls you down less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Suprafața Lunii este compusă din roci și praf. Stratul exterior al Lunii se numește scoarță. Scoarța are o grosime de circa 70 km în partea apropiată și 100 km în partea îndepărtată. Este mai subțire sub mări și mai groasă în zonele de relief mai înalt. S-ar putea să fie mai multă maria în partea apropiată, deoarece crusta este mai subțire. A fost mai ușor pentru lavă să se ridice la suprafață.
mt: The Moon's surface is composed of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust has a thickness of about 70 km in the near side and 100 km in the far side. It is thinner under the seas and thicker in the higher relief areas. There may be more maria in the near side, because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

It is thinner under the seas and thicker in the higher relief areas. There may be more maria in the near side, because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Mulți oameni visează la ziua în care ființele umane vor putea călători către o altă stea și vor explora alte lumi. Unii oameni se întreabă ce este acolo; alții cred că pe altă planetă pot trăi extratereștri sau alte forme de viață. „Dar, dacă se va întâmpla vreodată, probabil că nu va fi pentru o perioadă foarte lungă de timp. Stelele sunt atât de răspândite încât stelele «vecine» se află la trilioane de mile una de alta.” Poate că, într-o bună zi, strănepoții tăi vor păși pe solul unei lumi extraterestre, întrebându-se despre soarta strămoșilor lor.
mt: Many people dream of the day when human beings will be able to travel to another star and explore other worlds. Some people wonder what is out there; others believe that extraterrestrials or other forms of life may live on another planet. “But if it ever happens, it will probably not be for a very long time. Stars are so widespread that ‘neighboring’ stars are trillions of miles apart.” Perhaps, one day, your great-grandchildren will step onto the surface of an extraterrestrial world, wondering about the fate of their ancestors.
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Soarele nu are o crustă tare ca Pământul, pe care să poți sta. Întregul Soare este alcătuit din gaze, foc și plasmă. Gazul se subțiază pe măsură ce crește distanța față de centrul Soarelui. „Partea externă pe care o putem vedea privind către Soare se numește fotosferă, însemnând «sferă de lumină».”
mt: The Sun does not have a solid crust like Earth, on which you can stand. The entire Sun is made up of gases, fire and plasma. Gas thins as distance from the Sun's center increases. "The outer part we can see looking at the Sun is called the photosphere, meaning'sphere of light.'"
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: După aproximativ 3000 de ani, în 1610, astronomul italian Galileo Galilei, folosind un telescop, a observat că Venus are faze, la fel ca Luna. Fazele au loc deoarece doar partea laterală a lui Venus (sau a Lunii), orientată spre Soare, este iluminată. Fazele lui Venus au susținut teoria lui Copernic conform căreia planetele se învârt în jurul Soarelui. Apoi, câțiva ani mai târziu, în 1639, un astronom englez pe nume Jeremiah Horrocks a observat un tranzit al lui Venus.
mt: 3000 years after the invention of the telescope, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei observed that Venus has phases, like the Moon. Phases occur because only the side of Venus (or the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that planets revolve around the Sun. A few years later, in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Fluviul Amazon este al doilea cel mai lung și cel mai mare fluviu de pe Pământ. El transportă de peste 8 ori mai multă apă decât al doilea cel mai mare fluviu. Amazonul este, de asemenea, cel mai lat fluviu de pe Pământ, având pe alocuri o lățime de șase mile. Nu mai puțin de 20 la sută din apa care se scurge în oceane din râurile planetei provine din Amazon. Fluviul Amazon are 6.387 km (3.980 mile). El acumulează apa a mii de ape mai mici.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river on Earth. It carries more than eight times as much water as the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times being six miles wide. No less than 20 percent of the water that flows into the oceans from rivers on the planet comes from the Amazon. The Amazon River is 3,980 miles long. It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Optsprezece la sută dintre venezueleni sunt fără ocupație, iar cea mai mare parte a celor cu loc de muncă lucrează în economia subterană. Două treimi locuitorii Venezuelei care lucrează o sunt angajați în sectorul serviciilor, aproape un sfert lucrează în industrie, iar a cincea parte lucrează în agricultură. O industrie importantă pentru venezuelani este cea petrolieră, Venezuela fiind un exportator net în acest domeniu, deși doar 1% din populație lucrează în această industrie.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those with jobs work in the underground economy. Two-thirds of the country's workforce is employed in the service sector, almost a quarter in industry, and the fifth part in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is the petroleum industry, Venezuela being a net exporter in this field, although only 1% of the population works in this industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
